sentences.zh: 楚之先祖出自帝顓頊高陽。

translations.literal: Chu's first ancestors came from Emperor Zhuan Xu Gao Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's earliest ancestors descended from Emperor Zhuanxu, also known as Gaoyang.

sentences.zh: 高陽者，黃帝之孫，昌意之子也。

translations.literal: Gao Yang was Yellow Emperor's grandson, Chang Yi's son.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Yang was the Yellow Emperor's grandson and Chang Yi's son.

sentences.zh: 高陽生稱，稱生卷章，卷章生重黎。

translations.literal: Gao Yang begot Cheng. Cheng begot Juan Zhang. Juan Zhang begot Chong Li.
translations.idiomatic: Gaoyang fathered Cheng. Cheng fathered Juanzhang. Juanzhang fathered Chongli.

sentences.zh: 重黎為帝嚳高辛居火正，甚有功，能光融天下，帝嚳命曰祝融。

translations.literal: Chong Li served Emperor Ku Gao Xin as fire official. He had great merit and could illuminate and unite the world. Emperor Ku named him Zhu Rong.
translations.idiomatic: Chongli served Emperor Ku (also known as Gaoxin) as Minister of Fire. He performed great deeds and was able to illuminate and unify the world. Emperor Ku bestowed upon him the name Zhurong.

sentences.zh: 共工氏作亂，帝嚳使重黎誅之而不盡。

translations.literal: The Gong Gong clan made rebellion. Emperor Ku sent Chong Li to execute them but he did not complete it.
translations.idiomatic: The Gonggong clan rebelled. Emperor Ku sent Chongli to execute them, but he did not complete the task.

sentences.zh: 帝乃以庚寅日誅重黎，而以其弟吳回為重黎後，復居火正，為祝融。

translations.literal: The emperor then executed Chong Li on the Geng Yin day, and made his younger brother Wu Hui Chong Li's successor. He again served as fire official and became Zhu Rong.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then executed Chongli on the day Gengyin, and appointed his younger brother Wuhui as Chongli's successor. Wuhui resumed the position of Minister of Fire and became known as Zhurong.

sentences.zh: 吳回生陸終。

translations.literal: Wu Hui begot Lu Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Wuhui fathered Luzhong.

sentences.zh: 陸終生子六人，坼剖而產焉。

translations.literal: Lu Zhong begot six sons. They were born by splitting open.
translations.idiomatic: Luzhong fathered six sons, who were born by splitting open their mother's womb.

sentences.zh: 其長一曰昆吾；

translations.literal: His eldest named Kun Wu;
translations.idiomatic: His eldest was named Kun Wu;

sentences.zh: 二曰參胡；

translations.literal: Second named Shen Hu;
translations.idiomatic: The second was named Shenhu;

sentences.zh: 三曰彭祖；

translations.literal: Third named Peng Zu;
translations.idiomatic: The third was named Pengzu;

sentences.zh: 四曰會人；

translations.literal: Fourth named Hui Ren;
translations.idiomatic: The fourth was named Huiren;

sentences.zh: 五曰曹姓；

translations.literal: Fifth surnamed Cao;
translations.idiomatic: The fifth bore the surname Cao;

sentences.zh: 六曰季連，羋姓，楚其後也。

translations.literal: Sixth named Ji Lian, surnamed Mi. Chu were their descendants.
translations.idiomatic: The sixth was named Jilian, and bore the surname Mi. The Chu were their descendants.

sentences.zh: 昆吾氏，夏之時嘗為侯伯，桀之時湯滅之。

translations.literal: The Kun Wu clan, in Xia times, once was a marquis elder. In Jie's time, Tang extinguished it.
translations.idiomatic: The Kunwu clan, during the Xia dynasty, once served as a feudal lord. During Jie of Xia's reign, Tang of Shang destroyed them.

sentences.zh: 彭祖氏，殷之時嘗為侯伯，殷之末世滅彭祖氏。

translations.literal: The Peng Zu clan, in Yin times, once was a marquis elder. In Yin's last age, the Peng Zu clan was extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: The Pengzu clan, during the Yin dynasty, once served as a feudal lord. In the final days of Yin, the Pengzu clan was destroyed.

sentences.zh: 季連生附沮，附沮生穴熊。

translations.literal: Ji Lian begot Fu Ju. Fu Ju begot Xue Xiong.
translations.idiomatic: Jilian fathered Fuju. Fuju fathered Xuexiong.

sentences.zh: 其後中微，或在中國，或在蠻夷，弗能紀其世。

translations.literal: Their descendants declined in the middle period. Some were in the central states, some in the barbarian Yi. They could not record their generations.
translations.idiomatic: In later generations, their descendants declined in status. Some lived in the central states, others among the barbarian tribes. Their genealogies could not be properly recorded.

sentences.zh: 周文王之時，季連之苗裔曰鬻熊。

translations.literal: Zhou Wen Wang time, Ji Lian's descendants named Yu Xiong.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhou Wen Wang's time, Ji Lian's descendants were named Yu Xiong.

sentences.zh: 鬻熊子事文王，蚤卒。

translations.literal: Yu Xiong died early.
translations.idiomatic: Yuxiong served King Wen but died young.

sentences.zh: 其子曰熊麗。

translations.literal: His son was named Xiong Li.
translations.idiomatic: His son was named Xiong Li.

sentences.zh: 熊麗生熊狂，熊狂生熊繹。

translations.literal: Xiong Li begot Xiong Kuang. Xiong Kuang begot Xiong Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Li fathered Xiong Kuang. Xiong Kuang fathered Xiong Yi.

sentences.zh: 熊繹當周成王之時，舉文、武勤勞之後嗣，而封熊繹於楚蠻，封以子男之田，姓羋氏，居丹陽。

translations.literal: Xiong Yi, in Zhou Cheng Wang's time, was raised as Wen and Wu's diligent labor descendants, and Xiong Yi was enfeoffed in Chu barbarian lands. He was enfeoffed with zi and nan fields, surnamed Mi clan, and resided at Dan Yang.
translations.idiomatic: During the reign of King Cheng of Zhou, Xiong Yi was recognized as a descendant of Kings Wen and Wu who had performed meritorious service. He was enfeoffed in the Chu barbarian territories with lands befitting a viscount or baron, given the surname Mi, and settled at Dan Yang.

sentences.zh: 楚子熊繹與魯公伯禽、衛康叔子牟、晉侯燮、齊太公子呂伋俱事成王。

translations.literal: Chu zi Xiong Yi with Lu gong Bo Qin, Wei Kang Shu son Mu, Jin hou Xie, Qi eldest son Lü Ji all served Cheng Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Chu zi Xiong Yi, along with Lu gong Bo Qin, Wei Kang Shu's son Mu, Jin hou Xie, and Qi's eldest son Lü Ji, all served Cheng Wang.

sentences.zh: 熊繹生熊艾，熊艾生熊亶，熊亶生熊勝。

translations.literal: Xiong Yi begot Xiong Ai. Xiong Ai begot Xiong Dan. Xiong Dan begot Xiong Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yi fathered Xiong Ai. Xiong Ai fathered Xiong Dan. Xiong Dan fathered Xiong Sheng.

sentences.zh: 熊勝以弟熊楊為後。

translations.literal: Xiong Sheng made his younger brother Xiong Yang his successor.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Sheng designated his younger brother Xiong Yang as his heir.

sentences.zh: 熊楊生熊渠。

translations.literal: Xiong Yang begot Xiong Qu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yang fathered Xiong Qu.

sentences.zh: 熊渠生子三年。

translations.literal: Xiong Qu begot three sons.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Qu had three sons.

sentences.zh: 當周夷王之時，王室微，諸侯或不朝，相伐。

translations.literal: In Zhou Yi Wang's time, the wang chamber declined. Some feudal lords did not attend court and attacked each other.
translations.idiomatic: During the reign of King Yi of Zhou, the royal house declined in power. Some feudal lords ceased paying court and began attacking one another.

sentences.zh: 熊渠甚得江漢閒民和，乃興兵伐庸、楊蠆，至于鄂。

translations.literal: Xiong Qu greatly obtained harmony with the people between Jiang and Han, so he raised troops and attacked Yong and Yang Lao, reaching E.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Qu won the hearts of the people in the region between the Jiang and Han Rivers. He raised an army and attacked Yong and Yanglao, advancing as far as E.

sentences.zh: 熊渠曰：「我蠻夷也，不與中國之號謚。」

translations.literal: Xiong Qu said: 'I barbarian Yi, not with central states titles posthumous names.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Qu said: 'I am barbarian Yi. I do not use the central states' titles and posthumous names.'

sentences.zh: 乃立其長子康為句亶王，中子紅為鄂王，少子執疵為越章王，皆在江上楚蠻之地。

translations.literal: He then established his eldest son Kang as Gou Dan wang, middle son Hong as E wang, and youngest son Zhi Ci as Yue Zhang wang, all in the Chu barbarian lands on the Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: He then installed his eldest son Kang as King of Goudan, his middle son Hong as King of E, and his youngest son Zhici as King of Yuezhang, all in the Chu barbarian territories along the Yangtze River.

sentences.zh: 及周厲王之時，暴虐，熊渠畏其伐楚，亦去其王。

translations.literal: When Zhou Li Wang's time, he was tyrannical and cruel. Xiong Qu feared he would attack Chu, so he also removed their wang titles.
translations.idiomatic: When King Li of Zhou came to power and ruled tyrannically, Xiong Qu feared he would attack Chu, so he had his sons relinquish their royal titles.

sentences.zh: 後為熊毋康，毋康蚤死。

translations.literal: Later he became Xiong Wu Kang, and Wu Kang died early.
translations.idiomatic: Later, Xiong Qu became known as Xiong Wukang, but Wukang died young.

sentences.zh: 熊渠卒，子熊摯紅立。

translations.literal: Xiong Qu died, and his son Xiong Zhi Hong was established.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Qu died, and his son Xiong Zhihong ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 摯紅卒，其弟弒而代立，曰熊延。

translations.literal: Zhi Hong died, and his younger brother assassinated him and replaced him as established, named Xiong Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Zhihong died, and his younger brother assassinated him and usurped the throne, becoming known as Xiong Yan.

sentences.zh: 熊延生熊勇。

translations.literal: Xiong Yan begot Xiong Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yan fathered Xiong Yong.

sentences.zh: 熊勇六年，而周人作亂，攻厲王，厲王出奔彘。

translations.literal: In Xiong Yong's sixth year, the Zhou people made rebellion, attacked Li Wang, and Li Wang fled to Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Yong's sixth year, the people of Zhou rebelled, attacked King Li, and forced him to flee to Zhi.

sentences.zh: 熊勇十年，卒，弟熊嚴為後。

translations.literal: In Xiong Yong's tenth year, he died, and his younger brother Xiong Yan became successor.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Yong's tenth year, he died, and his younger brother Xiong Yan became his successor.

sentences.zh: 熊嚴十年，卒。

translations.literal: In Xiong Yan's tenth year, he died.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Yan's tenth year, he died.

sentences.zh: 有子四人，長子伯霜，中子仲雪，次子叔堪，少子季徇。

translations.literal: He had four sons: eldest Bo Shuang, middle Zhong Xue, next Shu Kan, youngest Ji Xun.
translations.idiomatic: He had four sons: the eldest was Boshuang, the middle one Zhongxue, the next one Shukan, and the youngest Jixun.

sentences.zh: 熊嚴卒，長子伯霜代立，是為熊霜。

translations.literal: Xiong Yan died, and his eldest son Bo Shuang replaced him as established. This was Xiong Shuang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yan died, and his eldest son Boshuang succeeded him as ruler. This was Xiong Shuang.

sentences.zh: 熊霜元年，周宣王初立。

translations.literal: In Xiong Shuang's first year, Zhou Xuan Wang was first established.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Shuang's first year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 熊霜六年，卒，三弟爭立。

translations.literal: In Xiong Shuang's sixth year, he died, and his three younger brothers contended for establishment.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Shuang's sixth year, he died, and his three younger brothers fought for the throne.

sentences.zh: 仲雪死；

translations.literal: Zhong Xue died;
translations.idiomatic: Zhongxue died;

sentences.zh: 叔堪亡，避難於濮；

translations.literal: Shu Kan fled, avoided difficulty at Pu;
translations.idiomatic: Shu Kan fled and avoided difficulty at Pu;

sentences.zh: 而少弟季徇立，是為熊徇。

translations.literal: But the youngest brother Ji Xun was established. This was Xiong Xun.
translations.idiomatic: But the youngest brother Jixun ascended the throne. This was Xiong Xun.

sentences.zh: 熊徇十六年，鄭桓公初封於鄭。

translations.literal: In Xiong Xun's sixteenth year, Zheng Huan Gong was first enfeoffed at Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Xun's sixteenth year, Duke Huan of Zheng was first enfeoffed at Zheng.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，熊徇卒，子熊咢立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Xiong Xun died, and his son Xiong E was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Xiong Xun died, and his son Xiong E ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 熊咢九年，卒，子熊儀立，是為若敖。

translations.literal: In Xiong E's ninth year, he died, and his son Xiong Yi was established. This was Ruo Ao.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong E's ninth year, he died, and his son Xiong Yi ascended the throne. This was King Ruoao.

sentences.zh: 若敖二十年，周幽王為犬戎所弒，周東徙，而秦襄公始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: In Ruo Ao's twentieth year, Zhou You Wang was assassinated by Quan Rong, Zhou moved east, and Qin Xiang Gong began to be ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In King Ruoao's twentieth year, King You of Zhou was assassinated by the Quanrong barbarians. The Zhou court moved eastward, and Duke Xiang of Qin first became recognized as a feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，若敖卒，子熊坎立，是為霄敖。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Ruo Ao died, and his son Xiong Kan was established. This was Xiao Ao.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, King Ruoao died, and his son Xiong Kan ascended the throne. This was King Xiaoao.

sentences.zh: 霄敖六年，卒，子熊眴立，是為蚡冒。

translations.literal: In Xiao Ao's sixth year, he died, and his son Xiong Shen was established. This was Fen Mao.
translations.idiomatic: In King Xiaoao's sixth year, he died, and his son Xiong Shen ascended the throne. This was King Fenmao.

sentences.zh: 蚡冒十三年，晉始亂，以曲沃之故。

translations.literal: In Fen Mao's thirteenth year, Jin began disorder, because of Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: In King Fenmao's thirteenth year, disorder began in Jin because of the Quwo affair.

sentences.zh: 蚡冒十七年，卒。

translations.literal: In Fen Mao's seventeenth year, he died.
translations.idiomatic: In King Fenmao's seventeenth year, he died.

sentences.zh: 蚡冒弟熊通弒蚡冒子而代立，是為楚武王。

translations.literal: Fen Mao's younger brother Xiong Tong assassinated Fen Mao's son and replaced him as established. This was Chu Wu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: King Fenmao's younger brother Xiong Tong assassinated Fenmao's son and usurped the throne. This was King Wu of Chu.

sentences.zh: 武王十七年，晉之曲沃莊伯弒主國晉孝侯。

translations.literal: Wu Wang seventeenth year, Jin's Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated main state Jin Xiao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In Wu Wang's seventeenth year, Jin's Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated the main state's Jin Xiao Hou.

sentences.zh: 十九年，鄭伯弟段作亂。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Zheng bo's younger brother Duan made rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Duke Zhuang of Zheng's younger brother Duan rebelled.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，鄭侵天子之田。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Zheng invaded the tian zi's fields.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Zheng invaded the Son of Heaven's domains.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，衛弒其君桓公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Wei assassinated their lord Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, the state of Wei assassinated their ruler Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Lu assassinated their lord Yin Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, the state of Lu assassinated their ruler Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，宋太宰華督弒其君殤公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Song grand steward Hua Du assassinated their lord Shang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Hua Du, chief minister of Song, assassinated his ruler Duke Shang.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，楚伐隨。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Chu attacked Sui.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Chu attacked Sui.

sentences.zh: 隨曰：「我無罪。」

translations.literal: Sui said: 'I no crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Sui said: 'I have no crime.'

sentences.zh: 楚曰：「我蠻夷也。

translations.literal: Chu said: 'I barbarian Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Chu said: 'I am barbarian Yi.

sentences.zh: 今諸侯皆為叛相侵，或相殺。

translations.literal: Now the feudal lords all become rebels who mutually invade, or mutually kill.
translations.idiomatic: Now all the feudal lords have become rebels who invade each other or assassinate one another.

sentences.zh: 我有敝甲，欲以觀中國之政，請王室尊吾號。」

translations.literal: I have worn armor, desire with observe central states governance, request wang chamber honor my title.'
translations.idiomatic: I have worn armor and desire to observe the central states' governance. I request the wang chamber honor my title.'

sentences.zh: 隨人為之周，請尊楚，王室不聽，還報楚。

translations.literal: The Sui people acted as intermediaries for them and requested to honor Chu. The wang chamber did not listen and returned to report to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Sui acted as intermediaries and requested that Chu be honored as king. The royal court refused to listen and sent word back to Chu.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，楚熊通怒曰：「吾先鬻熊，文王之師也，蚤終。

translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, Chu Xiong Tong angered said: 'My ancestor Yu Xiong, Wen Wang teacher, early ended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Chu Xiong Tong angrily said: 'My ancestor Yu Xiong was Wen Wang's teacher and ended early.

sentences.zh: 成王舉我先公，乃以子男田令居楚，蠻夷皆率服，而王不加位，我自尊耳。」

translations.literal: Cheng Wang raised my first duke, then with zi nan fields ordered reside Chu, barbarian Yi all led submit, but wang not added position, I self honor.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Wang raised my first duke and then with zi and nan fields ordered him to reside in Chu. The barbarian Yi all led and submitted, but the wang did not add position. I self-honor.'

sentences.zh: 乃自立為武王，與隨人盟而去。

translations.literal: He then self-established as Wu Wang, allied with the Sui people, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: He then proclaimed himself King Wu, formed an alliance with Sui, and departed.

sentences.zh: 於是始開濮地而有之。

translations.literal: Thereupon he began to open the Pu lands and possess them.
translations.idiomatic: From this point on, he began to develop and claim the Pu territories.

sentences.zh: 五十一年，周召隨侯，數以立楚為王。

translations.literal: In the fifty-first year, Zhou summoned the Sui hou and reproached him for establishing Chu as wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-first year, the Zhou court summoned the Marquis of Sui and reproached him for crowning Chu as king.

sentences.zh: 楚怒，以隨背己，伐隨。

translations.literal: Chu was angered because Sui turned back on them and attacked Sui.
translations.idiomatic: Chu was furious that Sui had betrayed them and attacked Sui.

sentences.zh: 武王卒師中而兵罷。

translations.literal: Wu Wang died in the midst of the army and the troops were dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu died while still in the field with his army, and the troops were disbanded.

sentences.zh: 子文王熊貲立，始都郢。

translations.literal: His son Wen Wang Xiong Zi was established and began to make Ying the capital.
translations.idiomatic: His son Xiong Zi ascended as King Wen and established Ying as the capital.

sentences.zh: 文王二年，伐申過鄧，鄧人曰「楚王易取」，鄧侯不許也。

translations.literal: Wen Wang second year, attacked Shen passed Deng, Deng people said 'Chu wang easy take', Deng hou not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: In Wen Wang's second year, he attacked Shen and passed through Deng. The Deng people said 'the Chu wang is easy to take,' but the Deng hou did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 六年，伐蔡，虜蔡哀侯以歸，已而釋之。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, he attacked Cai, captured Cai Ai Hou to return, and then released him.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, he attacked Cai, captured Duke Ai of Cai and took him back, but later released him.

sentences.zh: 楚彊，陵江漢閒小國，小國皆畏之。

translations.literal: Chu was strong and overawed the small countries between Jiang and Han. The small countries all feared it.
translations.idiomatic: Chu grew powerful and intimidated the small states between the Jiang and Han Rivers. All the small states feared it.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊桓公始霸，楚亦始大。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Qi Huan Gong began his hegemony, and Chu also began to become great.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Duke Huan of Qi began his era of hegemony, and Chu also began to grow powerful.

sentences.zh: 十二年，伐鄧，滅之。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he attacked Deng and extinguished it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he attacked Deng and destroyed it.

sentences.zh: 十三年，卒，子熊艱立，是為莊敖。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, he died, and his son Xiong Jian was established. This was Zhuang Ao.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, he died, and his son Xiong Jian ascended the throne. This was King Zhuangao.

sentences.zh: 莊敖五年，欲殺其弟熊惲，惲奔隨，與隨襲弒莊敖代立，是為成王。

translations.literal: In Zhuang Ao's fifth year, he desired to kill his younger brother Xiong Yun. Yun fled to Sui and with Sui attacked, assassinated Zhuang Ao, and replaced him as established. This was Cheng Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Zhuangao's fifth year, he tried to kill his younger brother Xiong Yun. Yun fled to Sui, and with Sui's help launched a surprise attack, assassinated Zhuangao, and usurped the throne. This was King Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成王惲元年，初即位，布德施惠，結舊好於諸侯。

translations.literal: In Cheng Wang Yun's first year, initially ascending the throne, he spread virtue and applied favor, tying old friendships with the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Cheng Yun's reign, upon ascending the throne, he spread virtue and kindness, renewing old alliances with the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 使人獻天子，天子賜胙，曰：「鎮爾南方夷越之亂，無侵中國。」

translations.literal: Sent people offered tian zi, tian zi granted blessing, said: 'Pacify your southern Yi Yue disorder, do not invade central states.'
translations.idiomatic: He sent people to offer to the tian zi. The tian zi granted blessing and said: 'Pacify your southern Yi and Yue disorder. Do not invade the central states.'

sentences.zh: 於是楚地千里。

translations.literal: Thereupon Chu's lands were a thousand li.
translations.idiomatic: From this point on, Chu's territory extended a thousand li.

sentences.zh: 十六年，齊桓公以兵侵楚，至陘山。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Qi Huan Gong with troops invaded Chu and arrived at Xing Mountain.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Duke Huan of Qi invaded Chu with his army and advanced as far as Mount Xing.

sentences.zh: 楚成王使將軍屈完以兵御之，與桓公盟。

translations.literal: Chu Cheng Wang sent the general Qu Wan with troops to resist them and allied with Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Chu sent the general Qu Wan with troops to resist them and formed an alliance with Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公數以周之賦不入王室，楚許之，乃去。

translations.literal: Huan Gong reproached that Zhou's taxes did not enter the wang chamber. Chu permitted it, and he then departed.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan reproached them that the Zhou court's taxes were not reaching the royal treasury. Chu agreed to this, and he then withdrew.

sentences.zh: 十八年，成王以兵北伐許，許君肉袒謝，乃釋之。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Cheng Wang with troops attacked Xu to the north. The Xu lord bared his flesh and apologized, so he released him.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, King Cheng attacked Xu to the north with his army. The Lord of Xu bared his torso in submission and apologized, so he released him.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，伐黃。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, he attacked Huang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, he attacked Huang.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，滅英。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, he extinguished Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, he destroyed Ying.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，宋襄公欲為盟會，召楚。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Song Xiang Gong desired to make an alliance meeting and summoned Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Duke Xiang of Song wanted to hold an alliance conference and summoned Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚王怒曰：「召我，我將好往襲辱之。」

translations.literal: Chu wang angered said: 'Summon me, I will properly go attack humiliate him.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu wang was angered and said: 'He summons me. I will properly go attack and humiliate him.'

sentences.zh: 遂行，至盂，遂執辱宋公，已而歸之。

translations.literal: He then proceeded, arrived at Yu, then seized and humiliated the Song gong, and then returned him.
translations.idiomatic: He then proceeded to the meeting, arrived at Meng, seized the Duke of Song and humiliated him, but later released him.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，鄭文公南朝楚。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, Zheng Wen Gong attended court at Chu to the south.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Zheng traveled south to pay court to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚成王北伐宋，敗之泓，射傷宋襄公，襄公遂病創死。

translations.literal: Chu Cheng Wang attacked Song to the north, defeated them at Hong, shot and wounded Song Xiang Gong. Xiang Gong then died from his illness and wound.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Chu attacked Song to the north, defeated them at the Hong River, shot and wounded Duke Xiang of Song. The duke later died from his wound and illness.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，晉公子重耳過楚，成王以諸侯客禮饗，而厚送之於秦。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Jin gong zi Chong Er passed through Chu. Cheng Wang feasted him with the feudal lords' guest ritual and thickly sent him to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, the Jin prince Chong Er passed through Chu. King Cheng entertained him with the full ceremonial rites due a feudal lord and provided him with generous gifts for his journey to Qin.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，魯僖公來請兵以伐齊，楚使申侯將兵伐齊，取穀，置齊桓公子雍焉。

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, Lu Xi Gong came and requested troops to attack Qi. Chu sent Shen Hou to lead troops and attack Qi, took Gu, and placed Qi Huan Gong's son Yong there.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, Duke Xi of Lu came requesting troops to attack Qi. Chu sent Lord Shen to lead an army against Qi, captured Gu, and installed Duke Huan of Qi's son Yong there.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公七子皆奔楚，楚盡以為上大夫。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong's seven sons all fled to Chu, and Chu completely made them upper grandees.
translations.idiomatic: All seven sons of Duke Huan of Qi fled to Chu, and Chu appointed them all as senior ministers.

sentences.zh: 滅夔，夔不祀祝融、鬻熊故也。

translations.literal: He extinguished Kui because Kui did not sacrifice to Zhu Rong and Yu Xiong.
translations.idiomatic: He destroyed Kui because Kui did not perform sacrifices to Zhurong and Yuxiong.

sentences.zh: 夏，伐宋，宋告急於晉，晉救宋，成王罷歸。

translations.literal: In summer, he attacked Song. Song reported urgent to Jin. Jin saved Song, and Cheng Wang dismissed and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, he attacked Song. Song appealed urgently to Jin for help. Jin rescued Song, so King Cheng withdrew.

sentences.zh: 將軍子玉請戰，成王曰：「重耳亡居外久，卒得反國，天之所開，不可當。」

translations.literal: General Zi Yu requested battle, Cheng Wang said: 'Chong Er fled resided outside long, ultimately obtained return country, heaven's opening, not resistable.'
translations.idiomatic: The general Zi Yu requested battle. Cheng Wang said: 'Chong Er fled and resided outside for a long time. He ultimately obtained to return to the country. It is heaven's opening and cannot be resisted.'

sentences.zh: 子玉固請，乃與之少師而去。

translations.literal: Zi Yu firmly requested, so he gave him few troops and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu insisted on going, so he gave him a small force and let him depart.

sentences.zh: 晉果敗子玉於城濮。

translations.literal: Jin indeed defeated Zi Yu at Cheng Pu.
translations.idiomatic: As expected, Jin defeated Zi Yu at Chengpu.

sentences.zh: 成王怒，誅子玉。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang was angered and executed Zi Yu.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng was furious and had Zi Yu executed.

sentences.zh: 四十六年，初，成王將以商臣為太子，語令尹子上。

translations.literal: In the forty-sixth year, initially, Cheng Wang would make Shang Chen the crown prince and told the Ling Yin Zi Shang.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-sixth year, King Cheng originally intended to make Shang Chen his crown prince and confided this to Prime Minister Zishang.

sentences.zh: 子上曰：「君之齒未也，而又多內寵，絀乃亂也。

translations.literal: Zi Shang said: 'Lord's age not yet, and moreover many inner favorites, demoting then rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Shang said: 'The lord's age is not yet advanced, and moreover there are many inner favorites. Demoting the crown prince would cause rebellion.

sentences.zh: 楚國之舉常在少者。

translations.literal: Chu country's selections often in young ones.
translations.idiomatic: Chu country's selections are often among the young ones.

sentences.zh: 且商臣蜂目而豺聲，忍人也，不可立也。」

translations.literal: Moreover Shang Chen wasp eyes and wolf voice, cruel person, not establishable.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover Shang Chen has wasp eyes and a wolf voice. He is a cruel person and cannot be established.'

sentences.zh: 王不聽，立之。

translations.literal: The wang did not listen and established him.
translations.idiomatic: The king refused to listen and installed him as crown prince anyway.

sentences.zh: 後又欲立子職而絀太子商臣。

translations.literal: Later he again desired to establish his son Zhi and demote the crown prince Shang Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Later, he wanted to install his son Zhi as crown prince and demote Shang Chen.

sentences.zh: 商臣聞而未審也，告其傅潘崇曰：「何以得其實？」

translations.literal: Shang Chen heard but not confirmed, told his tutor Pan Chong said: 'How obtain its truth?'
translations.idiomatic: Shang Chen heard but was not confirmed. He told his tutor Pan Chong: 'How can I obtain the truth?'

sentences.zh: 崇曰：「饗王之寵姬江羋而勿敬也。」

translations.literal: Chong said: 'Feast wang's favored consort Jiang Mi but not respect.'
translations.idiomatic: Chong said: 'Feast the wang's favored consort Jiang Mi but do not respect her.'

sentences.zh: 商臣從之。

translations.literal: Shang Chen followed it.
translations.idiomatic: Shang Chen agreed to this.

sentences.zh: 江羋怒曰：「宜乎王之欲殺若而立職也。」

translations.literal: Jiang Mi angered said: 'Suitable wang's desire kill you and establish Zhi.'
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Mi was angered and said: 'It is suitable that the wang desires to kill you and establish Zhi.'

sentences.zh: 商臣告潘崇曰：「信矣。」

translations.literal: Shang Chen told Pan Chong said: 'Believed.'
translations.idiomatic: Shang Chen told Pan Chong: 'It is believed.'

sentences.zh: 崇曰：「能事之乎？」

translations.literal: Chong said: 'Can serve him?'
translations.idiomatic: Chong said: 'Can you serve him?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「不能。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'I cannot.'

sentences.zh: 「能亡去乎？」

translations.literal: 'Can flee away?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Can you flee away?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「不能。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'I cannot.'

sentences.zh: 「能行大事乎？」

translations.literal: 'Can do great matter?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Can you do the great matter?'

translations.literal: Said: 'Can.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'I can.'

sentences.zh: 冬十月，商臣以宮衛兵圍成王。

translations.literal: In winter, tenth month, Shang Chen with palace guard troops surrounded Cheng Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In winter, during the tenth month, Shang Chen used palace guards to surround King Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成王請食熊蹯而死，不聽。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang requested to eat bear paws and die, but they did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng requested to eat bear paws and then die, but they refused.

sentences.zh: 丁未，成王自絞殺。

translations.literal: On Ding Wei, Cheng Wang strangled himself and died.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Dingwei, King Cheng hanged himself.

sentences.zh: 商臣代立，是為穆王。

translations.literal: Shang Chen replaced him as established. This was Mu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Shang Chen ascended the throne in his place. This was King Mu.

sentences.zh: 穆王立，以其太子宮予潘崇，使為太師，掌國事。

translations.literal: Mu Wang was established and gave his crown prince's palace to Pan Chong, making him grand tutor to grasp state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Upon ascending the throne, King Mu gave his crown prince's palace to Pan Chong and appointed him grand tutor to oversee state affairs.

sentences.zh: 穆王三年，滅江。

translations.literal: In Mu Wang's third year, he extinguished Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Mu's third year, he destroyed Jiang.

sentences.zh: 四年，滅六、蓼。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, he extinguished Liu and Liao.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he destroyed Liu and Liao.

sentences.zh: 六、蓼，皋陶之後。

translations.literal: Liu and Liao were Gao Tao's descendants.
translations.idiomatic: Liu and Liao were descendants of Gaoyao.

sentences.zh: 八年，伐陳。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, he attacked Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he attacked Chen.

sentences.zh: 十二年，卒。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he died.

sentences.zh: 子莊王侶立。

translations.literal: His son Zhuang Wang Lu was established.
translations.idiomatic: His son Lu ascended as King Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 莊王即位三年，不出號令，日夜為樂，令國中曰：「有敢諫者死無赦！」

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang ascended throne three years, not issued commands, day night for pleasure, ordered state middle said: 'Have dare admonish die without pardon!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Wang ascended the throne for three years without issuing commands. Day and night he engaged in pleasure and ordered those in the state: 'Anyone who dares admonish will die without pardon!'

sentences.zh: 伍舉入諫。

translations.literal: Wu Ju entered and admonished.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju entered the court and offered his counsel.

sentences.zh: 莊王左抱鄭姬，右抱越女，坐鐘鼓之閒。

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang embraced Zheng Ji on the left and Yue woman on the right, sitting amidst bells and drums.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang sat amidst bells and drums, with a Zheng beauty in his left arm and a Yue woman in his right.

sentences.zh: 伍舉曰：「願有進隱。」

translations.literal: Wu Ju said: 'Wish have advance metaphor.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju said: 'I wish to advance a metaphor.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「有鳥在於阜，三年不蜚不鳴，是何鳥也？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Have bird at mound, three years not fly not cry, what bird?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'There is a bird on the mound. For three years it does not fly and does not cry. What bird is this?'

sentences.zh: 莊王曰：「三年不蜚，蜚將沖天；

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang said: 'Three years not fly, fly will rush heaven;
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Wang said: 'Three years it does not fly, but when it flies it will rush to heaven;

sentences.zh: 三年不鳴，鳴將驚人。

translations.literal: Three years it does not cry, but when it cries it will startle people.
translations.idiomatic: It hasn't crowed for three years, but when it does crow, it will astonish the world.

sentences.zh: 舉退矣，吾知之矣。」

translations.literal: Ju retreated, I know it.'
translations.idiomatic: Ju has retreated. I know it.'

sentences.zh: 居數月，淫益甚。

translations.literal: After several months, his licentiousness increased even more.
translations.idiomatic: After several months, his debauchery grew even worse.

sentences.zh: 大夫蘇從乃入諫。

translations.literal: The grandee Su Cong then entered and admonished.
translations.idiomatic: The minister Su Cong then entered the court and offered his counsel.

sentences.zh: 王曰：「若不聞令乎？」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'You not hear command?'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'Have you not heard the command?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「殺身以明君，臣之願也。」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Kill body to enlighten lord, minister's wish.'
translations.idiomatic: He answered: 'To kill my body in order to enlighten the lord is my wish.'

sentences.zh: 於是乃罷淫樂，聽政，所誅者數百人，所進者數百人，任伍舉、蘇從以政，國人大說。

translations.literal: Thereupon he dismissed licentious pleasure and listened to governance. Those executed numbered several hundred people. Those advanced numbered several hundred people. He entrusted Wu Ju and Su Cong with governance, and the state people were greatly pleased.
translations.idiomatic: From that point on, he abandoned his debaucheries and attended to state affairs. He executed several hundred people and promoted several hundred others. He entrusted Wu Ju and Su Cong with governance, and the people of the state were greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 是歲滅庸。

translations.literal: This year he extinguished Yong.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, he destroyed Yong.

sentences.zh: 六年，伐宋，獲五百乘。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, he attacked Song and captured five hundred chariots.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, he attacked Song and captured five hundred chariots.

sentences.zh: 八年，伐陸渾戎，遂至洛，觀兵於周郊。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, he attacked the Lu Hun Rong, then arrived at Luo, and displayed troops in Zhou's outskirts.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he attacked the Luhun Rong barbarians, advanced to the Luo River, and paraded his troops on the outskirts of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周定王使王孫滿勞楚王。

translations.literal: Zhou Ding Wang sent Wang Sun Man to congratulate the Chu wang.
translations.idiomatic: King Ding of Zhou sent Wangsun Man to congratulate the King of Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚王問鼎小大輕重，對曰：「在德不在鼎。」

translations.literal: Chu wang asked tripods small large light heavy, answered said: 'In virtue not in tripods.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu wang asked about the tripods' size and weight. He answered: 'It is in virtue, not in the tripods.'

sentences.zh: 莊王曰：「子無阻九鼎！

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang said: 'You not hinder nine tripods!
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Wang said: 'Do not hinder the nine tripods!

sentences.zh: 楚國折鉤之喙，足以為九鼎。」

translations.literal: Chu state broken hook beak, sufficient for nine tripods.'
translations.idiomatic: Chu state's broken hook beaks are sufficient for the nine tripods.'

sentences.zh: 王孫滿曰：「嗚呼！

translations.literal: Wang Sun Man said: 'Alas!
translations.idiomatic: Wangsun Man said: 'Alas!

sentences.zh: 君王其忘之乎？

translations.literal: Lord wang perhaps forget it?
translations.idiomatic: Lord wang, have you perhaps forgotten it?

sentences.zh: 昔虞夏之盛，遠方皆至，貢金九牧，鑄鼎象物，百物而為之備，使民知神姦。

translations.literal: In the former flourishing of Yu and Xia, distant places all arrived. They contributed gold from the nine regions and cast tripods imaging things. The hundred things were prepared for them, making people know divine wickedness.
translations.idiomatic: In the flourishing days of Yu and Xia, even distant lands came to pay tribute. They contributed gold from the nine regions and cast tripods engraved with images of all things. All manner of objects were represented on them, so that the people might recognize divine wickedness.

sentences.zh: 桀有亂德，鼎遷於殷，載祀六百。

translations.literal: Jie had chaotic virtue. The tripods moved to Yin and endured for six hundred sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: When Jie became depraved, the tripods passed to Yin and endured there for six hundred years.

sentences.zh: 殷紂暴虐，鼎遷於周。

translations.literal: Yin Zhou was tyrannical and cruel. The tripods moved to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: When Yin tyrant Zhou became cruel and tyrannical, the tripods passed to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 德之休明，雖小必重；

translations.literal: Virtue's good brightness, though small must heavy;
translations.idiomatic: Virtue's good brightness - though small it must be heavy;

sentences.zh: 其姦回昏亂，雖大必輕。

translations.literal: Its wicked and perverse dim disorder - though great it must be light.
translations.idiomatic: When wickedness and perversity bring chaos and confusion, even a great dynasty must fall.

sentences.zh: 昔成王定鼎于郟鄏，卜世三十，卜年七百，天所命也。

translations.literal: Former Cheng Wang fixed tripods at Jia Yu, divined generations thirty, divined years seven hundred, heaven's command.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly Cheng Wang fixed the tripods at Jia Yu. He divined thirty generations and seven hundred years. It was heaven's command.

sentences.zh: 周德雖衰，天命未改。

translations.literal: Though Zhou virtue has declined, the heavenly mandate has not changed.
translations.idiomatic: Though the Zhou dynasty's virtue has declined, the Mandate of Heaven has not yet changed.

sentences.zh: 鼎之輕重，未可問也。」

translations.literal: Tripods' light heavy, not yet can ask.'
translations.idiomatic: The tripods' weight cannot yet be asked about.'

sentences.zh: 楚王乃歸。

translations.literal: The Chu wang then returned.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu then withdrew.

sentences.zh: 九年，相若敖氏。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, he made the Ruo Ao clan prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, he appointed someone from the Ruoao clan as prime minister.

sentences.zh: 人或讒之王，恐誅，反攻王，王擊滅若敖氏之族。

translations.literal: People some slandered it to wang, feared execution, counterattacked wang, wang attacked extinguished Ruo Ao clan's lineage.
translations.idiomatic: Some people slandered it to the wang. They feared execution and counterattacked the wang. The wang attacked and extinguished the Ruo Ao clan's lineage.

sentences.zh: 十三年，滅舒。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, he extinguished Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, he destroyed Shu.

sentences.zh: 十六年，伐陳，殺夏徵舒。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, he attacked Chen and killed Xia Zheng Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, he attacked Chen and executed Xia Zhengshu.

sentences.zh: 徵舒弒其君，故誅之也。

translations.literal: Zheng Shu had assassinated his lord, therefore he executed him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhengshu had assassinated his ruler, so King Zhuang executed him.

sentences.zh: 已破陳，即縣之。

translations.literal: Having already broken Chen, he immediately made it a county.
translations.idiomatic: Having conquered Chen, he immediately converted it into a county.

sentences.zh: 群臣皆賀，申叔時使齊來，不賀。

translations.literal: The group of ministers all congratulated. Shen Shu Shi came as envoy from Qi and did not congratulate.
translations.idiomatic: All the ministers congratulated him. Shen Shushi, who had come as envoy from Qi, did not offer congratulations.

sentences.zh: 王問，對曰：「鄙語曰，牽牛徑人田，田主取其牛。

translations.literal: Wang asked, answered said: 'Vulgar saying: Leading ox through person's field, field owner takes its ox.
translations.idiomatic: The wang asked. He answered: 'A vulgar saying goes: Leading an ox through a person's field, the field owner takes its ox.

sentences.zh: 徑者則不直矣，取之牛不亦甚乎？

translations.literal: Through one then not straight, taking its ox not also excessive?
translations.idiomatic: One who goes through it is then not straight. Taking its ox is not also excessive?

sentences.zh: 且王以陳之亂而率諸侯伐之，以義伐之而貪其縣，亦何以復令於天下！」

translations.literal: Moreover wang because Chen's disorder led feudal lords attacked it, with righteousness attacked it but greedy its county, also how to again command world!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover the wang, because of Chen's disorder, led the feudal lords to attack it. He attacked it with righteousness but was greedy for its county. How can he again command the world!'

sentences.zh: 莊王乃復國陳後。

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang then restored the state of Chen later.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang later restored Chen as an independent state.

sentences.zh: 十七年春，楚莊王圍鄭，三月克之。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, spring, Chu Zhuang Wang surrounded Zheng and conquered it in three months.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the seventeenth year, King Zhuang of Chu besieged Zheng and captured it after three months.

sentences.zh: 入自皇門，鄭伯肉袒牽羊以逆，曰：「孤不天，不能事君，君用懷怒，以及敝邑，孤之罪也。

translations.literal: Entered from Huang gate, Zheng bo bared flesh led sheep to welcome, said: 'Orphan not heaven, cannot serve lord, lord used cherished anger, reached humble city, orphan's crime.
translations.idiomatic: He entered from the Huang gate. The Zheng bo bared his flesh and led a sheep to welcome him, saying: 'The orphan is not favored by heaven and cannot serve the lord. The lord used cherished anger and reached my humble city. This is the orphan's crime.

sentences.zh: 敢不惟命是聽！

translations.literal: Dare not only command listen!
translations.idiomatic: How dare I not listen only to your command!

sentences.zh: 賓之南海，若以臣妾賜諸侯，亦惟命是聽。

translations.literal: Make it a guest in the southern sea. If you grant it as minister or concubine to the feudal lords, I also listen only to your command.
translations.idiomatic: Treat it as a guest in the southern seas. If you wish to grant it as a servant or concubine to the other lords, I will obey your command.

sentences.zh: 若君不忘厲、宣、桓、武，不絕其社稷，使改事君，孤之願也，非所敢望也。

translations.literal: If lord not forget Li, Xuan, Huan, Wu, not cut their altars soil, make change serve lord, orphan's wish, not what dare hope.
translations.idiomatic: If the lord does not forget Li, Xuan, Huan, and Wu, and does not cut off their altars and soil, making them change to serve the lord - that is the orphan's wish, though not what I dare hope for.

sentences.zh: 敢布腹心。」

translations.literal: Dare spread inner thoughts.'
translations.idiomatic: I dare to spread my inner thoughts.'

sentences.zh: 楚群臣曰：「王勿許。」

translations.literal: Chu group ministers said: 'Wang do not permit.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu group of ministers said: 'Wang, do not permit it.'

sentences.zh: 莊王曰：「其君能下人，必能信用其民，庸可絕乎！」

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang said: 'Its lord can lower people, must can trust use its people, how can cut off!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Wang said: 'Its lord can lower himself to people. He must be able to trust and use his people. How can we cut him off!'

sentences.zh: 莊王自手旗，左右麾軍，引兵去三十里而舍，遂許之平。

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang personally held the flag and waved the army with his left and right. He led the troops to depart thirty li and camped, then permitted peace.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang personally held the flag and directed the army left and right. He led his troops thirty li away and camped, then granted them peace.

sentences.zh: 潘尪入盟，子良出質。

translations.literal: Pan Wang entered to ally, and Zi Liang went out as hostage.
translations.idiomatic: Panwang entered the alliance, and Ziliang went out as hostage.

sentences.zh: 夏六月，晉救鄭，與楚戰，大敗晉師河上，遂至衡雍而歸。

translations.literal: In summer, sixth month, Jin saved Zheng and battled with Chu. They greatly defeated the Jin army on the river upper, then arrived at Heng Yong and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of summer, Jin came to Zheng's aid and fought with Chu. They decisively defeated the Jin army by the river, then pursued them to Hengyong before returning.

sentences.zh: 二十年，圍宋，以殺楚使也。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, he surrounded Song because they had killed a Chu envoy.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, he besieged Song, because they had killed a Chu envoy.

sentences.zh: 圍宋五月，城中食盡，易子而食，析骨而炊。

translations.literal: He surrounded Song for five months. Food in the city was exhausted. They exchanged sons to eat and split bones to cook.
translations.idiomatic: After besieging Song for five months, the city ran out of food. People exchanged children to eat and broke bones to burn as fuel.

sentences.zh: 宋華元出告以情。

translations.literal: Song Hua Yuan went out and told the situation.
translations.idiomatic: Hua Yuan of Song went out and explained the situation.

sentences.zh: 莊王曰：「君子哉！」

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang said: 'Superior man!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Wang said: 'What a superior man!'

sentences.zh: 遂罷兵去。

translations.literal: He then dismissed the troops and departed.
translations.idiomatic: He then disbanded his army and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，莊王卒，子共王審立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Zhuang Wang died, and his son Gong Wang Shen was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, King Zhuang died, and his son King Gong Shen ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 共王十六年，晉伐鄭。

translations.literal: In Gong Wang's sixteenth year, Jin attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In King Gong's sixteenth year, Jin attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭告急，共王救鄭。

translations.literal: Zheng reported urgent, and Gong Wang saved Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng sent an urgent appeal, and King Gong came to its rescue.

sentences.zh: 與晉兵戰鄢陵，晉敗楚，射中共王目。

translations.literal: He battled with Jin troops at Yan Ling. Jin defeated Chu and shot, hitting Gong Wang's eye.
translations.idiomatic: He fought with Jin forces at Yanling. Jin defeated Chu, and an arrow struck King Gong in the eye.

sentences.zh: 共王召將軍子反。

translations.literal: Gong Wang summoned the general Zi Fan.
translations.idiomatic: King Gong summoned the general Zifan.

sentences.zh: 子反嗜酒，從者豎陽穀進酒醉。

translations.literal: Zi Fan was addicted to wine. His follower Shu Yang Gu presented wine and got him drunk.
translations.idiomatic: Zifan was addicted to wine. His attendant Shu Yanggu kept serving him wine until he was drunk.

sentences.zh: 王怒，射殺子反，遂罷兵歸。

translations.literal: The wang was angered, shot and killed Zi Fan, then dismissed the troops and returned.
translations.idiomatic: The king was furious, shot and killed Zifan, then disbanded the army and returned home.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，共王卒，子康王招立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Gong Wang died, and his son Kang Wang Zhao was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, King Gong died, and his son King Kang Zhao ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 康王立十五年卒，子員立，是為郟敖。

translations.literal: Kang Wang was established for fifteen years and died. His son Yuan was established. This was Jia Ao.
translations.idiomatic: King Kang reigned fifteen years and died. His son Yuan ascended the throne, becoming King Jia'ao.

sentences.zh: 康王寵弟公子圍、子比、子皙、棄疾。

translations.literal: Kang Wang favored his younger brothers Gong zi Wei, Zi Bi, Zi Xi, and Qi Ji.
translations.idiomatic: King Kang favored his younger brothers: Gongzi Wei, Zibi, Zixi, and Qiji.

sentences.zh: 郟敖三年，以其季父康王弟公子圍為令尹，主兵事。

translations.literal: In Jia Ao's third year, he made his young uncle Kang Wang's younger brother Gong zi Wei the Ling Yin to master military affairs.
translations.idiomatic: In King Jia'ao's third year, he appointed his uncle Gongzi Wei (King Kang's younger brother) as prime minister to oversee military affairs.

sentences.zh: 四年，圍使鄭，道聞王疾而還。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Wei was envoy to Zheng, but en route heard of the wang's illness and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Wei was sent as envoy to Zheng, but heard of the king's illness on the way and returned.

sentences.zh: 十二月己酉，圍入問王疾，絞而弒之，遂殺其子莫及平夏。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month on Ji You, Wei entered and inquired about the wang's illness. He strangled and assassinated him, then killed his sons Mo and Ping Xia.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Jiyou in the twelfth month, Wei entered to inquire about the king's illness. He strangled and killed him, then executed his sons Mo and Pingxia.

sentences.zh: 使使赴於鄭。

translations.literal: He sent an envoy to announce to Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: He sent an envoy to announce the news to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 伍舉問曰：「誰為後？」

translations.literal: Wu Ju asked said: 'Who for successor?'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju asked: 'Who will be the successor?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「寡大夫圍。」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Our grandee Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: He answered: 'Our grandee Wei.'

sentences.zh: 伍舉更曰：「共王之子圍為長。」

translations.literal: Wu Ju changed said: 'Gong Wang son Wei for elder.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju changed and said: 'Gong Wang's son Wei is the elder.'

sentences.zh: 子比奔晉，而圍立，是為靈王。

translations.literal: Zi Bi fled to Jin, and Wei was established. This was Ling Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zibi fled to Jin, while Wei ascended the throne, becoming King Ling.

sentences.zh: 靈王三年六月，楚使使告晉，欲會諸侯。

translations.literal: In Ling Wang's third year, sixth month, Chu sent an envoy to tell Jin, desiring to meet with the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of King Ling's third year, Chu sent an envoy to Jin proposing a meeting of all the lords.

sentences.zh: 諸侯皆會楚于申。

translations.literal: The feudal lords all met Chu at Shen.
translations.idiomatic: All the lords assembled with Chu at Shen.

sentences.zh: 伍舉曰：「昔夏啟有鈞臺之饗，商湯有景亳之命，周武王有盟津之誓，成王有岐陽之閒，康王有豐宮之朝，穆王有涂山之會，齊桓有召陵之師，晉文有踐土之盟，君其何用？」

translations.literal: Wu Ju said: 'Former Xia Qi had Gou Tai feast, Shang Tang had Jing Bo command, Zhou Wu Wang had Meng Jin oath, Cheng Wang had Qi Yang meeting, Kang Wang had Feng Gong court, Mu Wang had Tu Shan assembly, Qi Huan had Zhao Ling army, Jin Wen had Jian Tu alliance, lord what use?'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju said: 'Formerly Xia Qi had the Gou Tai feast, Shang Tang had the Jing Bo command, Zhou Wu Wang had the Meng Jin oath, Cheng Wang had the Qi Yang meeting, Kang Wang had the Feng Gong court, Mu Wang had the Tu Shan assembly, Qi Huan had the Zhao Ling army, Jin Wen had the Jian Tu alliance. What will the lord use?'

sentences.zh: 靈王曰：「用桓公。」

translations.literal: Ling Wang said: 'Use Huan Gong.'
translations.idiomatic: King Ling said, 'Follow Duke Huan's example.'

sentences.zh: 時鄭子產在焉。

translations.literal: At the time, Zheng Zi Chan was there.
translations.idiomatic: Zichan of Zheng was present at the time.

sentences.zh: 於是晉、宋、魯、衛不往。

translations.literal: Thereupon Jin, Song, Lu, and Wei did not go.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, Jin, Song, Lu, and Wei did not attend.

sentences.zh: 靈王已盟，有驕色。

translations.literal: Ling Wang had already allied and had an arrogant expression.
translations.idiomatic: After the alliance, King Ling displayed an arrogant demeanor.

sentences.zh: 伍舉曰：「桀為有仍之會，有緡叛之。

translations.literal: Wu Ju said: 'Jie for You Reng assembly, You Min rebelled him.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju said: 'Jie held the You Reng assembly, and You Min rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 紂為黎山之會，東夷叛之。

translations.literal: Zhou held the Li Shan assembly, and the eastern Yi rebelled against him.
translations.idiomatic: When King Zhou held the assembly at Mount Li, the eastern Yi tribes rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 幽王為太室之盟，戎、翟叛之。

translations.literal: You Wang held the Tai Shi alliance, and the Rong and Di rebelled against him.
translations.idiomatic: When King You held the alliance at Taishi, the Rong and Di tribes rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 君其慎終！」

translations.literal: Lord be careful end!'
translations.idiomatic: Lord, be careful of the end!'

sentences.zh: 七月，楚以諸侯兵伐吳，圍朱方。

translations.literal: In the seventh month, Chu with the feudal lords' troops attacked Wu and surrounded Zhu Fang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month, Chu led the allied forces to attack Wu and besiege Zhufang.

sentences.zh: 八月，克之，囚慶封，滅其族。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, he conquered it, imprisoned Qing Feng, and extinguished his clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, they captured it, imprisoned Qing Feng, and exterminated his clan.

sentences.zh: 以封徇，曰：「無效齊慶封弒其君而弱其孤，以盟諸大夫！」

translations.literal: With territory paraded, said: 'Do not imitate Qi Qing Feng assassinated his lord and weakened his orphan, to ally various grandees!'
translations.idiomatic: He paraded the territory and said: 'Do not imitate Qi Qing Feng who assassinated his lord and weakened his orphan, to ally with the various grandees!'

sentences.zh: 封反曰：「莫如楚共王庶子圍弒其君兄之子員而代之立！」

translations.literal: Feng countered said: 'Nothing like Chu Gong Wang concubine son Wei assassinated his lord elder brother son Yuan and replaced established!'
translations.idiomatic: Feng countered: 'Nothing is like Chu Gong Wang's concubine son Wei who assassinated his lord's elder brother's son Yuan and replaced him as established!'

sentences.zh: 於是靈王使（棄）疾殺之。

translations.literal: Thereupon Ling Wang sent (Qi) Ji kill him.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Ling Wang sent (Qi) Ji to kill him.

sentences.zh: 七年，就章華臺，下令內亡人實之。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he completed the Zhang Hua Tai and issued an order for inner fleeing people to fill it.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, he completed the Zhanghua Terrace and ordered fugitives from within the realm to populate it.

sentences.zh: 八年，使公子棄疾將兵滅陳。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, he sent Gong zi Qi Ji to lead troops and extinguish Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he sent Prince Qiji to lead troops and destroy Chen.

sentences.zh: 十年，召蔡侯，醉而殺之。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, he summoned the Cai hou, got him drunk, and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he summoned the Marquis of Cai, got him drunk, and murdered him.

sentences.zh: 使棄疾定蔡，因為陳蔡公。

translations.literal: He sent Qi Ji to pacify Cai and became the Chen Cai gong.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Qiji to pacify Cai, and Qiji became Duke of Chen and Cai.

sentences.zh: 十一年，伐徐以恐吳。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, he attacked Xu to frighten Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, he attacked Xu to intimidate Wu.

sentences.zh: 靈王次於乾豀以待之。

translations.literal: Ling Wang lodged at Qian Xi to await them.
translations.idiomatic: King Ling camped at Qianxi to wait for them.

sentences.zh: 王曰：「齊、晉、魯、衛，其封皆受寶器，我獨不。

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Qi, Jin, Lu, Wei, their enfeoffments all received precious vessels, I alone not.
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'Qi, Jin, Lu, Wei - their enfeoffments all received precious vessels, but I alone did not.

sentences.zh: 今吾使使周求鼎以為分，其予我乎？」

translations.literal: Now I send envoy Zhou seek tripods as share, will give me?'
translations.idiomatic: Now I will send an envoy to Zhou to seek the tripods as my share. Will they give me?'

sentences.zh: 析父對曰：「其予君王哉！

translations.literal: Xi Fu answered said: 'Will give lord wang!
translations.idiomatic: Xi Fu answered: 'They will give to the lord wang!

sentences.zh: 昔我先王熊繹辟在荊山，蓽露藍蔞以處草莽，跋涉山林以事天子，唯是桃弧棘矢以共王事。

translations.literal: Formerly our former wang Xiong Yi avoided being at Jing Shan. He exposed himself to dew and blue vines to dwell in the grass wilds. He trudged through mountains and forests to serve the heavenly son, contributing only peach bows and thorn arrows to the wang's affairs.
translations.idiomatic: In ancient times, our ancestor King Xiong Yi took refuge in the Jing Mountains. Exposed to dew and brambles, he lived in the wilderness. He traversed mountains and forests to serve the Son of Heaven, offering only peach bows and thorn arrows in tribute to the royal court.

sentences.zh: 齊，王舅也；

translations.literal: Qi, wang maternal uncle;
translations.idiomatic: Qi is the wang's maternal uncle;

sentences.zh: 晉及魯、衛，王母弟也：楚是以無分而彼皆有。

translations.literal: Jin and Lu, Wei, wang maternal younger brothers: Chu therefore no share but they all have.
translations.idiomatic: Jin as well as Lu and Wei are the wang's maternal younger brothers: Therefore Chu has no share but they all have.

sentences.zh: 周今與四國服事君王，將惟命是從，豈敢愛鼎？」

translations.literal: Zhou now with four states serve lord wang, will only command follow, how dare cherish tripods?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou now together with the four states serves the lord wang. They will follow only the command. How dare they cherish the tripods?'

sentences.zh: 靈王曰：「昔我皇祖伯父昆吾舊許是宅，今鄭人貪其田，不我予，今我求之，其予我乎？」

translations.literal: Ling Wang said: 'Former my imperial ancestor uncle Kun Wu old promised this residence, now Zheng people greedy their fields, not give me, now I seek it, will give me?'
translations.idiomatic: Ling Wang said: 'Formerly my imperial ancestor uncle Kun Wu old promised this residence. Now Zheng people are greedy for their fields and do not give me. Now I seek it. Will they give me?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「周不愛鼎，鄭安敢愛田？」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Zhou not cherish tripods, Zheng how dare cherish fields?'
translations.idiomatic: He answered: 'If Zhou does not cherish the tripods, how dare Zheng cherish the fields?'

sentences.zh: 靈王曰：「昔諸侯遠我而畏晉，今吾大城陳、蔡、不羹，賦皆千乘，諸侯畏我乎？」

translations.literal: Ling Wang said: 'Former feudal lords distant me feared Jin, now I great walled Chen, Cai, Bu Geng, levies all thousand chariots, feudal lords fear me?'
translations.idiomatic: Ling Wang said: 'Formerly the feudal lords were distant from me and feared Jin. Now I have greatly walled Chen, Cai, and Bu Geng. The levies are all a thousand chariots. Do the feudal lords fear me?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「畏哉！」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Fear!'
translations.idiomatic: He answered: 'They fear!'

sentences.zh: 靈王喜曰：「析父善言古事焉。」

translations.literal: Ling Wang pleased said: 'Xi Fu good at speaking ancient matters.'
translations.idiomatic: Ling Wang was pleased and said: 'Xi Fu is good at speaking about ancient matters.'

sentences.zh: 十二年春，楚靈王樂乾豀，不能去也。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, spring, Chu Ling Wang enjoyed Qian Xi and could not depart.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the twelfth year, King Ling of Chu was enjoying Qianxi so much that he could not bring himself to leave.

sentences.zh: 國人苦役。

translations.literal: The state people suffered from the corvee.
translations.idiomatic: The people of the state suffered under the corvée labor.

sentences.zh: 初，靈王會兵於申，僇越大夫常壽過，殺蔡大夫觀起。

translations.literal: Initially, Ling Wang assembled troops at Shen, executed Yue grandee Chang Shou Guo, and killed Cai grandee Guan Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Earlier, King Ling had assembled troops at Shen, executed the Yue minister Chang Shouguo, and killed the Cai minister Guan Qi.

sentences.zh: 起子從亡在吳，乃勸吳王伐楚，為閒越大夫常壽過而作亂，為吳閒。

translations.literal: Qi's son Cong fled and was in Wu. He then urged the Wu wang to attack Chu, to alienate Yue grandee Chang Shou Guo and make him rebel, acting as alienation for Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Qi's son Cong had fled to Wu. He urged the King of Wu to attack Chu, sowing discord between Wu and the Yue minister Chang Shouguo to incite rebellion, thus serving Wu's interests.

sentences.zh: 使矯公子棄疾命召公子比於晉，至蔡，與吳、越兵欲襲蔡。

translations.literal: He sent a falsified command from Gong zi Qi Ji to summon Gong zi Bi from Jin. He arrived at Cai and, with Wu and Yue troops, desired to attack Cai.
translations.idiomatic: He forged an order in Prince Qiji's name summoning Prince Bi from Jin. Upon arriving at Cai, he joined with Wu and Yue forces intending to attack Cai by surprise.

sentences.zh: 令公子比見棄疾，與盟於鄧。

translations.literal: He commanded Gong zi Bi to see Qi Ji and ally at Deng.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered Prince Bi to meet with Qiji and form an alliance at Deng.

sentences.zh: 遂入殺靈王太子祿，立子比為王，公子子皙為令尹，棄疾為司馬。

translations.literal: They then entered and killed Ling Wang's crown prince Lu. They established Zi Bi as wang, Gong zi Zi Xi as Ling Yin, and Qi Ji as Si Ma.
translations.idiomatic: They then entered the capital, killed King Ling's crown prince Lu, established Zibi as king, made Prince Zixi prime minister, and appointed Qiji as minister of war.

sentences.zh: 先除王宮，觀從從師于乾豀，令楚眾曰：「國有王矣。

translations.literal: First cleared wang palace, Guan Cong followed army at Qian Xi, commanded Chu masses said: 'State has wang.
translations.idiomatic: They first cleared the wang palace. Guan Cong followed the army at Qian Xi and commanded the Chu masses: 'The state has a wang.

sentences.zh: 先歸，復爵邑田室。

translations.literal: Those who return first will have their ranks, fiefs, fields, and chambers restored.
translations.idiomatic: Those who return first will have their titles, territories, fields, and homes restored.

sentences.zh: 後者遷之。」

translations.literal: Later ones move them.'
translations.idiomatic: Those who come later will be moved.'

sentences.zh: 楚眾皆潰，去靈王而歸。

translations.literal: The Chu masses all collapsed and departed from Ling Wang to return.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu multitudes all deserted, abandoning King Ling and returning home.

sentences.zh: 靈王聞太子祿之死也，自投車下，而曰：「人之愛子亦如是乎？」

translations.literal: Ling Wang heard crown prince Lu's death, self threw under chariot, and said: 'People's love for sons also like this?'
translations.idiomatic: Ling Wang heard of crown prince Lu's death and threw himself under the chariot, saying: 'Do people love their sons like this too?'

sentences.zh: 侍者曰：「甚是。」

translations.literal: Attendant said: 'Very correct.'
translations.idiomatic: The attendant said: 'Very correct.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「余殺人之子多矣，能無及此乎？」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'I killed people's sons many, can not reach this?'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'I have killed many people's sons. How could this not happen?'

sentences.zh: 右尹曰：「請待於郊以聽國人。」

translations.literal: Right Yin said: 'Please wait at suburbs to listen to state people.'
translations.idiomatic: The Right Yin said: 'Please wait in the suburbs to listen to the state people.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「眾怒不可犯。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Masses anger cannot violate.'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'The masses' anger cannot be violated.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「且入大縣而乞師於諸侯。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Moreover enter large county and beg troops from feudal lords.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Moreover, enter a large county and beg for troops from the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「皆叛矣。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'All rebelled.'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'They have all rebelled.'

sentences.zh: 又曰：「且奔諸侯以聽大國之慮。」

translations.literal: Again said: 'Moreover flee to feudal lords to listen to great states' considerations.'
translations.idiomatic: He again said: 'Moreover, flee to the feudal lords to listen to the great states' considerations.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「大福不再，祗取辱耳。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Great fortune not again, only take humiliation.'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'Great fortune does not come again. It would only bring humiliation.'

sentences.zh: 於是王乘舟將欲入鄢。

translations.literal: Thereupon the wang boarded a boat and desired to enter Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the king boarded a boat intending to enter Yan.

sentences.zh: 右尹度王不用其計，懼俱死，亦去王亡。

translations.literal: The Right Yin saw that the wang would not use his plan. He feared they would die together and also departed from the wang and fled.
translations.idiomatic: The Right Minister saw that the king would not heed his advice. Fearing they would both die, he abandoned the king and fled.

sentences.zh: 靈王於是獨傍偟山中，野人莫敢入王。

translations.literal: Ling Wang was then alone beside Sao Mountain. No wild people dared to approach the wang.
translations.idiomatic: King Ling was now alone by Mount Sao in the wilderness. No one dared approach the king.

sentences.zh: 王行遇其故鋗人，謂曰：「為我求食，我已不食三日矣。」

translations.literal: Wang walking encountered his former armor smith, told said: 'For me seek food, I already not eat three days.'
translations.idiomatic: As the wang walked, he encountered his former armor smith and said: 'Seek food for me. I have not eaten for three days already.'

sentences.zh: 鋗人曰：「新王下法，有敢閒王從王者，罪及三族，且又無所得食。」

translations.literal: Armor smith said: 'New wang issued law, have dare secretly wang follow wang, crime reaches three clans, moreover also no obtain food.'
translations.idiomatic: The armor smith said: 'The new wang has issued a law. Anyone who dares to secretly help the wang or follow him will have their crime reach three clans. Moreover, there is no food to be obtained.'

sentences.zh: 王因枕其股而臥。

translations.literal: The wang then pillowed his thigh and lay down.
translations.idiomatic: The king then used his thigh as a pillow and lay down to sleep.

sentences.zh: 鋗人又以土自代，逃去。

translations.literal: The armor smith again used earth to substitute for himself and escaped.
translations.idiomatic: The armorer again fashioned a clay figure to take his place and escaped.

sentences.zh: 王覺而弗見，遂饑弗能起。

translations.literal: The wang awoke and did not see him. He was then hungry and could not rise.
translations.idiomatic: The king awoke and saw no one there. He was famished and too weak to stand.

sentences.zh: 芋尹申無宇之子申亥曰：「吾父再犯王命，王弗誅，恩孰大焉！」

translations.literal: Yu Yin Shen Wu Yu son Shen Hai said: 'My father twice violated wang command, wang not executed, favor who greater!'
translations.idiomatic: Yu Yin Shen Wu Yu's son Shen Hai said: 'My father twice violated the wang's command, but the wang did not execute him. Whose favor is greater than this!'

sentences.zh: 乃求王，遇王饑於釐澤，奉之以歸。

translations.literal: He then sought the wang. He encountered the wang hungry at Xi Ze and served him to return.
translations.idiomatic: He then searched for the king. He found the king starving at Xize Marsh and brought him food to take him home.

sentences.zh: 夏五月癸丑，王死申亥家，申亥以二女從死，并葬之。

translations.literal: In summer, fifth month, Gui Chou day, the wang died at Shen Hai's home. Shen Hai had his two daughters follow him in death and buried them together.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Gui Chou in the fifth month of summer, the king died at Shen Hai's home. Shen Hai had his two daughters accompany him in death, and they were buried together.

sentences.zh: 是時楚國雖已立比為王，畏靈王復來，又不聞靈王死，故觀從謂初王比曰：「不殺棄疾，雖得國猶受禍。」

translations.literal: At this time Chu state though already established Bi as wang, feared Ling Wang return again, moreover not heard Ling Wang death, therefore Guan Cong told new wang Bi said: 'Not kill Qi Ji, though obtain state still receive calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: At this time, although the Chu state had already established Bi as wang, they feared Ling Wang would return again. Moreover, they had not heard of Ling Wang's death. Therefore Guan Cong told the new wang Bi: 'If you do not kill Qi Ji, though you obtain the state you will still receive calamity.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「余不忍。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'I not bear.'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'I cannot bear to.'

sentences.zh: 從曰：「人將忍王。」

translations.literal: Cong said: 'People will bear wang.'
translations.idiomatic: Cong said: 'People will bear against the wang.'

sentences.zh: 王不聽，乃去。

translations.literal: The wang did not listen and then departed.
translations.idiomatic: The king refused to listen and left.

sentences.zh: 棄疾歸。

translations.literal: Qi Ji returned.
translations.idiomatic: Qiji returned.

sentences.zh: 國人每夜驚，曰：「靈王入矣！」

translations.literal: State people every night alarmed, said: 'Ling Wang entered!'
translations.idiomatic: The state people were alarmed every night, saying: 'Ling Wang has entered!'

sentences.zh: 乙卯夜，棄疾使船人從江上走呼曰：「靈王至矣！」

translations.literal: Yi Mao night, Qi Ji sent boat people from Jiang upper running called said: 'Ling Wang arrived!'
translations.idiomatic: On the Yi Mao night, Qi Ji sent boat people to run along the Jiang and call out: 'Ling Wang has arrived!'

sentences.zh: 國人愈驚。

translations.literal: The state people were increasingly alarmed.
translations.idiomatic: The people grew increasingly terrified.

sentences.zh: 又使曼成然告初王比及令尹子皙曰：「王至矣！

translations.literal: Again sent Man Cheng Ran told new wang Bi and Ling Yin Zi Xi said: 'Wang arrived!
translations.idiomatic: He again sent Man Cheng Ran to tell the new wang Bi and Ling Yin Zi Xi: 'The wang has arrived!

sentences.zh: 國人將殺君，司馬將至矣！

translations.literal: State people will kill lord, Si Ma will arrive!
translations.idiomatic: The state people will kill the lord. The Si Ma will arrive!

sentences.zh: 君蚤自圖，無取辱焉。

translations.literal: Lord, plan for yourself early. Do not bring humiliation.
translations.idiomatic: My lord, act quickly for your own sake. Do not court humiliation.

sentences.zh: 眾怒如水火，不可救也。」

translations.literal: Masses anger like water fire, cannot save.'
translations.idiomatic: The masses' anger is like water and fire. It cannot be saved.'

sentences.zh: 初王及子皙遂自殺。

translations.literal: The new wang and Zi Xi then committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: The new king and Zixi then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 丙辰，棄疾即位為王，改名熊居，是為平王。

translations.literal: On Bing Chen day, Qi Ji ascended the throne as wang. He changed his name to Xiong Ju. This was Ping Wang.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Bingchen, Qiji ascended the throne. He changed his name to Xiong Ju, becoming King Ping.

sentences.zh: 平王以詐弒兩王而自立，恐國人及諸侯叛之，乃施惠百姓。

translations.literal: Ping Wang had assassinated two wangs through deception and established himself. He feared the state people and feudal lords would rebel against him, so he bestowed favor on the common people.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping had deceitfully assassinated two kings to seize the throne. Fearing rebellion from the people and other lords, he bestowed favors on the common folk.

sentences.zh: 復陳蔡之地而立其後如故，歸鄭之侵地。

translations.literal: He restored the lands of Chen and Cai and established their descendants as before. He returned Zheng's invaded lands.
translations.idiomatic: He restored the territories of Chen and Cai, reinstalling their royal descendants as before. He returned the lands he had seized from Zheng.

sentences.zh: 存恤國中，修政教。

translations.literal: He preserved and sympathized with those in the state, and repaired the government and teachings.
translations.idiomatic: He cared for the people within the realm and reformed the administration and education.

sentences.zh: 吳以楚亂故，獲五率以歸。

translations.literal: Wu, because of Chu's disorder, obtained five generals and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Wu, taking advantage of Chu's turmoil, captured five generals and returned home.

sentences.zh: 平王謂觀從：「恣爾所欲。」

translations.literal: Ping Wang told Guan Cong: 'Indulge your desires.'
translations.idiomatic: King Ping told Guan Cong, 'Do whatever you wish.'

sentences.zh: 欲為卜尹，王許之。

translations.literal: He desired to be the Bu Yin, and the wang permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: He wished to become Minister of Divination, and the king granted his request.

sentences.zh: 初，共王有寵子五人，無適立，乃望祭群神，請神決之，使主社稷，而陰與巴姬埋璧於室內，召五公子齋而入。

translations.literal: Initially, Gong Wang had five favored sons and no proper heir to establish. He then gazed and sacrificed to the group of spirits, requesting the spirits to decide it and make one master of the altars and soil. He secretly buried jade in the room with Ba Ji, and summoned the five gong zi, who purified themselves and entered.
translations.idiomatic: In the beginning, King Gong had five favored sons but no designated heir. He gazed toward the spirits and made sacrifices, asking the gods to choose who should rule the altars of soil and grain. Secretly, with Lady Ba, he buried a jade disc in the chamber, then summoned the five princes who had purified themselves to enter.

sentences.zh: 康王跨之，靈王肘加之，子比、子皙皆遠之。

translations.literal: Kang Wang straddled it. Ling Wang placed his elbow on it. Zi Bi and Zi Xi both distanced themselves from it.
translations.idiomatic: King Kang straddled it. King Ling rested his elbow on it. Zibi and Zixi both kept their distance.

sentences.zh: 平王幼，抱其上而拜，壓紐。

translations.literal: Ping Wang was young. He embraced its upper part and bowed, pressing the button.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping was young. He embraced the top and bowed, pressing down on the knob.

sentences.zh: 故康王以長立，至其子失之；

translations.literal: Therefore Kang Wang with elder established, arrived his son lost it;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Kang Wang was established as the elder. It came to his son who lost it;

sentences.zh: 圍為靈王，及身而弒；

translations.literal: Wei became Ling Wang, reached body assassinated;
translations.idiomatic: Wei became Ling Wang, and was assassinated in person;

sentences.zh: 子比為王十餘日，子皙不得立，又俱誅。

translations.literal: Zi Bi was wang for more than ten days. Zi Xi was not able to be established, and both were executed.
translations.idiomatic: Zibi reigned as king for more than ten days. Zixi was not established, and both were executed.

sentences.zh: 四子皆絕無後。

translations.literal: All four sons were cut off with no descendants.
translations.idiomatic: All four sons died without heirs.

sentences.zh: 唯獨棄疾後立，為平王，竟續楚祀，如其神符。

translations.literal: Only Qi Ji alone was later established. He became Ping Wang and finally continued the Chu sacrifices, just like the spirit's talisman.
translations.idiomatic: Only Qiji was later established. He became King Ping and continued the Chu ancestral sacrifices, fulfilling the divine omen.

sentences.zh: 初，子比自晉歸，韓宣子問叔向曰：「子比其濟乎？」

translations.literal: Initially, Zi Bi from Jin returned, Han Xuan Zi asked Shu Xiang said: 'Zi Bi will succeed?'
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Zi Bi returned from Jin, Han Xuan Zi asked Shu Xiang: 'Will Zi Bi succeed?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不就。」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Will not succeed.'
translations.idiomatic: He answered: 'He will not succeed.'

sentences.zh: 宣子曰：「同惡相求，如市賈焉，何為不就？」

translations.literal: Xuan Zi said: 'Same evil seek each other, like market merchants, why not succeed?'
translations.idiomatic: Xuan Zi said: 'Those of the same evil seek each other, like market merchants. Why would he not succeed?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「無與同好，誰與同惡？

translations.literal: Answered said: 'No with same good, who with same evil?
translations.idiomatic: He answered: 'If there is no one to share goodness with, who shares evil?

sentences.zh: 取國有五難：有寵無人，一也；

translations.literal: Taking state has five difficulties: have favor no people, one;
translations.idiomatic: Taking a state has five difficulties: having favor but no people is the first;

sentences.zh: 有人無主，二也；

translations.literal: Have people no master, two;
translations.idiomatic: Having people but no master is the second;

sentences.zh: 有主無謀，三也；

translations.literal: Have master no plan, three;
translations.idiomatic: Having a master but no plan is the third;

sentences.zh: 有謀而無民，四也；

translations.literal: Have plan but no people, four;
translations.idiomatic: Having a plan but no people is the fourth;

sentences.zh: 有民而無德，五也。

translations.literal: Having people but no virtue is the fifth.
translations.idiomatic: Fifth, to have subjects but lack virtue.

sentences.zh: 子比在晉十三年矣，晉、楚之從不聞通者，可謂無人矣；

translations.literal: Zi Bi in Jin thirteen years, Jin, Chu followers not heard communicating, can be called no people;
translations.idiomatic: Zi Bi has been in Jin for thirteen years. No followers from Jin or Chu have been heard communicating with him. This can be called having no people;

sentences.zh: 族盡親叛，可謂無主矣；

translations.literal: Clan exhausted kin rebelled, can be called no master;
translations.idiomatic: His clan is exhausted and his kin have rebelled. This can be called having no master;

sentences.zh: 無釁而動，可謂無謀矣；

translations.literal: No rift moved, can be called no plan;
translations.idiomatic: He moved without a rift. This can be called having no plan;

sentences.zh: 為羈終世，可謂無民矣；

translations.literal: As hostage ended life, can be called no people;
translations.idiomatic: He ended his life as a hostage. This can be called having no people;

sentences.zh: 亡無愛徵，可謂無德矣。

translations.literal: He fled with no beloved signs. This can be called having no virtue.
translations.idiomatic: He fled without any beloved tokens. This can truly be called lacking virtue.

sentences.zh: 王虐而不忌，子比涉五難以弒君，誰能濟之！

translations.literal: Wang cruel not cautious, Zi Bi crossed five difficulties to assassinate lord, who can succeed him!
translations.idiomatic: The wang was cruel and not cautious. Zi Bi crossed five difficulties to assassinate his lord. Who could succeed!

sentences.zh: 有楚國者，其棄疾乎？

translations.literal: Have Chu state, perhaps Qi Ji?
translations.idiomatic: The one who will have the Chu state - perhaps it is Qi Ji?

sentences.zh: 君陳、蔡，方城外屬焉。

translations.literal: He rules Chen and Cai. Fang Cheng belongs to the outer regions.
translations.idiomatic: He rules over Chen and Cai. Fangcheng belongs to the outer dependencies.

sentences.zh: 苛慝不作，盜賊伏隱，私欲不違，民無怨心。

translations.literal: Harsh evils do not arise. Robbers and bandits hide and conceal themselves. Private desires are not violated. The people have no resentful heart.
translations.idiomatic: Harsh crimes do not occur. Robbers and bandits lie low in hiding. Personal desires are not thwarted. The people harbor no resentment.

sentences.zh: 先神命之，國民信之。

translations.literal: The former spirits commanded it. The state people believe it.
