translations.idiomatic: The ancestral spirits ordained it. The people of the state believe in it.

sentences.zh: 羋姓有亂，必季實立，楚之常也。

translations.literal: Mi surname has disorder, must younger brother actually established, Chu's constant.
translations.idiomatic: When the Mi surname has disorder, it must be the younger brother who is actually established. This is Chu's constant way.

sentences.zh: 子比之官，則右尹也；

translations.literal: Zi Bi's office, then Right Yin;
translations.idiomatic: Zi Bi's office was Right Yin;

sentences.zh: 數其貴寵，則庶子也；

translations.literal: Count his noble favor, then concubine son;
translations.idiomatic: If we count his noble favor, he was a concubine son;

sentences.zh: 以神所命，則又遠之；

translations.literal: By spirits commanded, then moreover far from it;
translations.idiomatic: By what the spirits commanded, he was moreover far from it;

sentences.zh: 民無懷焉，將何以立？」

translations.literal: People no cherish him, how establish?'
translations.idiomatic: The people do not cherish him. How can he be established?'

sentences.zh: 宣子曰：「齊桓、晉文不亦是乎？」

translations.literal: Xuan Zi said: 'Qi Huan, Jin Wen not also so?'
translations.idiomatic: Xuan Zi said: 'Were not Qi Huan and Jin Wen also like this?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「齊桓，衛姬之子也，有寵於釐公。

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Qi Huan, Wei Ji son, had favor at Xi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He answered: 'Qi Huan was Wei Ji's son and had favor with Xi Gong.

sentences.zh: 有鮑叔牙、賓須無、隰朋以為輔，有莒、衛以為外主，有高、國以為內主。

translations.literal: He had Bao Shu Ya, Bin Xu Wu, and Xi Peng as assistants. He had Ju and Wei as outer masters, and Gao and Guo as inner masters.
translations.idiomatic: He had Bao Shuya, Bin Xuwu, and Xi Peng as advisors. Ju and Wei served as his external supporters, while Gao and Guo served as internal supporters.

sentences.zh: 從善如流，施惠不倦。

translations.literal: He followed good like a stream and bestowed favor without tiring.
translations.idiomatic: He followed virtue as naturally as water flows, and bestowed favors tirelessly.

sentences.zh: 有國，不亦宜乎？

translations.literal: Had state, not also fitting?
translations.idiomatic: He had the state. Was this not fitting?

sentences.zh: 昔我文公，狐季姬之子也，有寵於獻公。

translations.literal: Formerly our Wen Gong was Hu Ji Ji's son and had favor with Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the past, our Duke Wen was the son of Lady Hu Jiji and was favored by Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 好學不倦。

translations.literal: He loved learning and never tired of it.
translations.idiomatic: He was devoted to learning and never grew weary of it.

sentences.zh: 生十七年，有士五人，有先大夫子餘、子犯以為腹心，有魏犫、賈佗以為股肱，有齊、宋、秦、楚以為外主，有欒、郤、狐、先以為內主。

translations.literal: At seventeen years old, he had five scholars. He had former grandee Zi Yu and Zi Fan as his inner heart, Wei Chou and Jia Tuo as his limbs, Qi, Song, Qin, and Chu as outer masters, and Luan, Xi, Hu, and Xian as inner masters.
translations.idiomatic: At age seventeen, he had five worthy men. The former ministers Ziyv and Zifan were his heart and soul. Weichou and Jiattuo were his arms and legs. Qi, Song, Qin, and Chu were his external supporters. Luan, Xi, Hu, and Xian were his internal supporters.

sentences.zh: 亡十九年，守志彌篤。

translations.literal: He fled for nineteen years and guarded his will increasingly firmly.
translations.idiomatic: He was in exile for nineteen years, and his resolve grew ever stronger.

sentences.zh: 惠、懷棄民，民從而與之。

translations.literal: Hui and Huai abandoned the people, but the people followed and gave themselves to him.
translations.idiomatic: Dukes Hui and Huai abandoned the people, yet the people followed him and gave themselves to him.

sentences.zh: 故文公有國，不亦宜乎？

translations.literal: Therefore Wen Gong had state, not also fitting?
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Wen Gong had the state. Was this not fitting?

sentences.zh: 子比無施於民，無援於外，去晉，晉不送；

translations.literal: Zi Bi no bestow on people, no aid from outside, departed Jin, Jin not sent;
translations.idiomatic: Zi Bi bestowed nothing on the people and had no aid from outside. When he departed Jin, Jin did not send him;

sentences.zh: 歸楚，楚不迎。

translations.literal: When he returned to Chu, Chu did not welcome him.
translations.idiomatic: When he returned to Chu, Chu did not welcome him.

sentences.zh: 何以有國！」

translations.literal: How have state!'
translations.idiomatic: How could he have the state!'

sentences.zh: 子比果不終焉，卒立者棄疾，如叔向言也。

translations.literal: Zi Bi indeed did not succeed. The one finally established was Qi Ji, just as Shu Xiang said.
translations.idiomatic: Zibi indeed did not endure. The one finally established was Qiji, just as Shuxiang had predicted.

sentences.zh: 平王二年，使費無忌如秦為太子建取婦。

translations.literal: In Ping Wang's second year, he sent Fei Wu Ji to Qin to take a wife for crown prince Jian.
translations.idiomatic: In King Ping's second year, he sent Fei Wuji to Qin to find a wife for Crown Prince Jian.

sentences.zh: 婦好，來，未至，無忌先歸，說平王曰：「秦女好，可自娶，為太子更求。」

translations.literal: Wife good, coming, not arrived, Wu Ji first returned, persuaded Ping Wang said: 'Qin woman good, can self marry, for crown prince again seek.'
translations.idiomatic: The wife was good. She was coming but had not arrived when Wu Ji returned first and persuaded Ping Wang: 'The Qin woman is good. You can marry her yourself and seek another for the crown prince.'

sentences.zh: 平王聽之，卒自娶秦女，生熊珍。

translations.literal: Ping Wang listened and finally married the Qin woman himself, giving birth to Xiong Zhen.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping listened to him and ended up marrying the Qin woman himself, fathering Xiong Zhen.

sentences.zh: 更為太子娶。

translations.literal: He married again for the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: He found another wife for the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 是時伍奢為太子太傅，無忌為少傅。

translations.literal: At this time Wu She was the crown prince's grand tutor, and Wu Ji was the junior tutor.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Wu She was the crown prince's senior tutor, and Wuji was his junior tutor.

sentences.zh: 無忌無寵於太子，常讒惡太子建。

translations.literal: Wu Ji had no favor with the crown prince and constantly slandered and hated crown prince Jian.
translations.idiomatic: Wuji was not favored by the crown prince and constantly slandered and maligned Crown Prince Jian.

sentences.zh: 建時年十五矣，其母蔡女也，無寵於王，王稍益疏外建也。

translations.literal: Jian was fifteen years old at the time. His mother was a Cai woman with no favor from the wang. The wang gradually distanced himself increasingly from Jian.
translations.idiomatic: Jian was fifteen at the time. His mother was a woman from Cai who had no favor with the king. The king gradually grew more distant from Jian.

sentences.zh: 六年，使太子建居城父，守邊。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, he sent crown prince Jian to reside at Cheng Fu and guard the border.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, he sent Crown Prince Jian to live at Chengfu and guard the frontier.

sentences.zh: 無忌又日夜讒太子建於王曰：「自無忌入秦女，太子怨，亦不能無望於王，王少自備焉。

translations.literal: Wu Ji again day night slandered crown prince Jian to wang said: 'Since Wu Ji brought Qin woman, crown prince resentful, also cannot not hope for wang, wang slightly self prepare.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ji again slandered crown prince Jian to the wang day and night: 'Since Wu Ji brought the Qin woman, the crown prince is resentful. He also cannot help but harbor hopes for the wang. The wang should prepare himself slightly.

sentences.zh: 且太子居城父，擅兵，外交諸侯，且欲入矣。」

translations.literal: Moreover crown prince resides Cheng Fu, monopolizes troops, foreign relations feudal lords, moreover desires enter.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover the crown prince resides at Cheng Fu, monopolizes troops, conducts foreign relations with feudal lords, and moreover desires to enter.'

sentences.zh: 平王召其傅伍奢責之。

translations.literal: Ping Wang summoned his tutor Wu She and rebuked him.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping summoned his tutor Wu She and reprimanded him.

sentences.zh: 伍奢知無忌讒，乃曰：「王柰何以小臣疏骨肉？」

translations.literal: Wu She knew Wu Ji slandered, then said: 'Wang how with petty official distance kin?'
translations.idiomatic: Wu She knew Wu Ji had slandered him and said: 'How can the wang distance his kin because of a petty official?'

sentences.zh: 無忌曰：「今不制，後悔也。」

translations.literal: Wu Ji said: 'Now not control, later regret.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ji said: 'If we do not control this now, we will regret it later.'

sentences.zh: 於是王遂囚伍奢。

translations.literal: Thereupon the wang imprisoned Wu She.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the king imprisoned Wu She.

sentences.zh: ［而召其二子而告以免父死］乃令司馬奮揚召太子建，欲誅之。

translations.literal: [And summoned his two sons and told to save father death] Then commanded Si Ma Fen Yang summon crown prince Jian, desired execute him.
translations.idiomatic: [He summoned his two sons and told them it would save their father's life] Then he commanded Si Ma Fen Yang to summon crown prince Jian, desiring to execute him.

sentences.zh: 太子聞之，亡奔宋。

translations.literal: The crown prince heard this and fled to Song.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince heard of this and fled to Song.

sentences.zh: 無忌曰：「伍奢有二子，不殺者為楚國患。

translations.literal: Wu Ji said: 'Wu She has two sons, not kill will be Chu state calamity.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ji said: 'Wu She has two sons. If we do not kill them, they will be a calamity for the Chu state.

sentences.zh: 盍以免其父召之，必至。」

translations.literal: Why not with save their father summon them, certainly arrive.'
translations.idiomatic: Why not summon them saying it will save their father? They will certainly come.'

sentences.zh: 於是王使使謂奢：「能致二子則生，不能將死。」

translations.literal: Thereupon wang sent envoy told She: 'Can bring two sons then live, cannot will die.'
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the wang sent an envoy to tell She: 'If you can bring your two sons, you will live. If not, you will die.'

sentences.zh: 奢曰：「尚至，胥不至。」

translations.literal: She said: 'Shang arrive, Xu not arrive.'
translations.idiomatic: She said: 'Shang will arrive, Xu will not arrive.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「何也？」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Why?'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 奢曰：「尚之為人，廉，死節，慈孝而仁，聞召而免父，必至，不顧其死。

translations.literal: She said: 'Shang's character, upright, die for integrity, filial compassionate benevolent, hear summon save father, certainly arrive, not consider his death.
translations.idiomatic: She said: 'Shang's character is upright. He dies for integrity, is filial, compassionate, and benevolent. Hearing the summon to save his father, he will certainly come and not consider his own death.

sentences.zh: 胥之為人，智而好謀，勇而矜功，知來必死，必不來。

translations.literal: Xu's character, wise good planning, brave proud merit, know come certainly die, certainly not come.
translations.idiomatic: Xu's character is wise and good at planning, brave and proud of merit. Knowing that coming means certain death, he certainly will not come.

sentences.zh: 然為楚國憂者必此子。」

translations.literal: However for Chu state worry certainly this son.'
translations.idiomatic: However, the one who will bring worry to the Chu state will certainly be this son.'

sentences.zh: 於是王使人召之，曰：「來，吾免爾父。」

translations.literal: Thereupon wang sent person summon them, said: 'Come, I pardon your father.'
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the wang sent someone to summon them, saying: 'Come, I will pardon your father.'

sentences.zh: 伍尚謂伍胥曰：「聞父免而莫奔，不孝也；

translations.literal: Wu Shang told Wu Xu said: 'Hear father pardoned and not hasten, unfilial;
translations.idiomatic: Wu Shang told Wu Xu: 'To hear that father is pardoned and not hasten is unfilial;

sentences.zh: 父戮莫報，無謀也；

translations.literal: Father executed not avenge, no plan;
translations.idiomatic: To not avenge father's execution is having no plan;

sentences.zh: 度能任事，知也。

translations.literal: To assess what one can undertake is wisdom.
translations.idiomatic: To assess what one is capable of undertaking—that is wisdom.

sentences.zh: 子其行矣，我其歸死。」

translations.literal: You go, I return die.'
translations.idiomatic: You should go. I will return and die.'

sentences.zh: 伍尚遂歸。

translations.literal: Wu Shang then returned.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Shang then returned home.

sentences.zh: 伍胥彎弓屬矢，出見使者，曰：「父有罪，何以召其子為？」

translations.literal: Wu Xu bent bow attached arrow, out saw envoy, said: 'Father has crime, why summon his son for?'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu bent his bow and attached an arrow. He went out and saw the envoy, saying: 'Father has a crime. Why summon his son?'

sentences.zh: 將射，使者還走，遂出奔吳。

translations.literal: He was about to shoot when the envoy turned and ran away. He then fled out to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: He was about to shoot when the envoy turned and fled. He then escaped to Wu.

sentences.zh: 伍奢聞之，曰：「胥亡，楚國危哉。」

translations.literal: Wu She heard it, said: 'Xu fled, Chu state in danger!'
translations.idiomatic: Wu She heard this and said: 'Xu has fled. The Chu state is in danger!'

sentences.zh: 楚人遂殺伍奢及尚。

translations.literal: The Chu people then killed Wu She and Shang.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu authorities then executed Wu She and Shang.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚太子建母在居巢，開吳。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Chu crown prince Jian's mother was at Ju Chao and opened it to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Crown Prince Jian's mother was at Juchao and surrendered it to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳使公子光伐楚，遂敗陳、蔡，取太子建母而去。

translations.literal: Wu sent Gong zi Guang to attack Chu. He then defeated Chen and Cai, took crown prince Jian's mother, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Wu sent Prince Guang to attack Chu. He then defeated Chen and Cai, took Crown Prince Jian's mother captive, and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 楚恐，城郢。

translations.literal: Chu feared and walled Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Chu grew fearful and fortified Ying.

sentences.zh: 初，吳之邊邑卑梁與楚邊邑鐘離小童爭桑，兩家交怒相攻，滅卑梁人。

translations.literal: Initially, Wu's border town Bei Liang and Chu's border town Zhong Li had young boys disputing over mulberries. The two families became mutually angered and attacked each other, extinguishing the Bei Liang people.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, boys from Wu's border town Beiliang and Chu's border town Zhongli quarreled over mulberry trees. The two families became enraged and attacked each other, wiping out the people of Beiliang.

sentences.zh: 卑梁大夫怒，發邑兵攻鐘離。

translations.literal: The Bei Liang grandee was angered and mobilized town troops to attack Zhong Li.
translations.idiomatic: The magistrate of Beiliang was furious and mobilized the town's militia to attack Zhongli.

sentences.zh: 楚王聞之怒，發國兵滅卑梁。

translations.literal: The Chu wang heard and was angered. He mobilized state troops and extinguished Bei Liang.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu heard of this and was enraged. He mobilized state troops and destroyed Beiliang.

sentences.zh: 吳王聞之大怒，亦發兵，使公子光因建母家攻楚，遂滅鐘離、居巢。

translations.literal: The Wu wang heard and was greatly angered. He also mobilized troops and sent Gong zi Guang to attack Chu through Jian's mother's home. He then extinguished Zhong Li and Ju Chao.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wu heard of this and was greatly enraged. He also mobilized troops and sent Prince Guang to attack Chu via Jian's mother's residence. Guang then destroyed Zhongli and Juchao.

sentences.zh: 楚乃恐而城郢。

translations.literal: Chu then feared and walled Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Chu grew fearful and fortified Ying.

sentences.zh: 十三年，平王卒。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Ping Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, King Ping died.

sentences.zh: 將軍子常曰：「太子珍少，且其母乃前太子建所當娶也。」

translations.literal: General Zi Chang said: 'Crown prince Zhen young, moreover his mother was former crown prince Jian should marry.'
translations.idiomatic: General Zi Chang said: 'Crown prince Zhen is young, and moreover his mother was the one former crown prince Jian should have married.'

sentences.zh: 欲立令尹子西。

translations.literal: He desired to establish Ling Yin Zi Xi.
translations.idiomatic: He wished to install Zixi as prime minister.

sentences.zh: 子西，平王之庶弟也，有義。

translations.literal: Zi Xi was Ping Wang's concubine younger brother and had righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Zixi was King Ping's half-brother by a concubine and was known for his integrity.

sentences.zh: 子西曰：「國有常法，更立則亂，言之則致誅。」

translations.literal: Zi Xi said: 'State has constant law, change establish then disorder, speak then bring execution.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xi said: 'The state has constant law. To change the establishment brings disorder. To speak of it brings execution.'

sentences.zh: 乃立太子珍，是為昭王。

translations.literal: They then established crown prince Zhen. This was Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: They then established Crown Prince Zhen as king. He became King Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭王元年，楚眾不說費無忌，以其讒亡太子建，殺伍奢子父與郤宛。

translations.literal: In Zhao Wang's first year, the Chu masses were not pleased with Fei Wu Ji because his slander caused crown prince Jian to flee. They killed Wu She and his sons, and Xi Wan.
translations.idiomatic: In King Zhao's first year, the Chu people were displeased with Fei Wuji because his slander had driven Crown Prince Jian into exile. They killed Wu She and his sons, as well as Xi Wan.

sentences.zh: 宛之宗姓伯氏子及子胥皆奔吳，吳兵數侵楚，楚人怨無忌甚。

translations.literal: Wan's clan surname Bai clan sons and Zi Xu all fled Wu, Wu troops frequently invaded Chu, Chu people resented Wu Ji very much.
translations.idiomatic: Wan's clan surname Bai clan's sons and Zi Xu all fled to Wu. Wu troops frequently invaded Chu, and the Chu people resented Wu Ji very much.

sentences.zh: 楚令尹子常誅無忌以說眾，眾乃喜。

translations.literal: Chu Ling Yin Zi Chang executed Wu Ji to please the masses, and the masses were then happy.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu prime minister Zichang executed Wuji to appease the people, and the people were then satisfied.

sentences.zh: 四年，吳三公子奔楚，楚封之以捍吳。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Wu's three gong zi fled to Chu. Chu enfeoffed them to defend against Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, three Wu princes defected to Chu. Chu enfeoffed them with territories to help defend against Wu.

sentences.zh: 五年，吳伐取楚之六、潛。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Wu attacked took Chu's Liu, Qian.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Wu attacked and took Chu's Liu and Qian.

sentences.zh: 七年，楚使子常伐吳，吳大敗楚於豫章。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Chu sent Zi Chang to attack Wu. Wu greatly defeated Chu at Yu Zhang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Chu sent Zichang to attack Wu. Wu decisively defeated Chu at Yuzhang.

sentences.zh: 十年冬，吳王闔閭、伍子胥、伯與唐、蔡俱伐楚，楚大敗，吳兵遂入郢，辱平王之墓，以伍子胥故也。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, winter, Wu wang He Lu, Wu Zi Xu, Bai Yu, Tang, and Cai all attacked Chu. Chu was greatly defeated. Wu troops then entered Ying and humiliated Ping Wang's tomb, because of Wu Zi Xu's reason.
translations.idiomatic: In winter of the tenth year, King Helü of Wu, along with Wu Zixu, Baiyu, Tang, and Cai, all attacked Chu. Chu suffered a crushing defeat. Wu troops entered Ying and desecrated King Ping's tomb—because of Wu Zixu's grudge.

sentences.zh: 吳兵之來，楚使子常以兵迎之，夾漢水陣。

translations.literal: When Wu troops came, Chu sent Zi Chang with troops to welcome them, arrayed flanking the Han water.
translations.idiomatic: When the Wu army arrived, Chu sent Zichang with troops to meet them, arraying their forces along both banks of the Han River.

sentences.zh: 吳伐敗子常，子常亡奔鄭。

translations.literal: Wu attacked and defeated Zi Chang. Zi Chang fled to Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Wu attacked and defeated Zichang. Zichang fled to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 楚兵走，吳乘勝逐之，五戰及郢。

translations.literal: Chu troops fled. Wu rode their victory and pursued them. After five battles they reached Ying.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu army fled. Wu pressed their advantage and pursued them. After five battles, they reached Ying.

sentences.zh: 己卯，昭王出奔。

translations.literal: On Ji Mao, Zhao Wang fled out.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Jimao, King Zhao fled the capital.

sentences.zh: 庚辰，吳人入郢。

translations.literal: On Geng Chen, Wu people entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Gengchen, Wu forces entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 昭王亡也至雲夢。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang, while fleeing, arrived at Yun Meng.
translations.idiomatic: As King Zhao fled, he reached the Yunmeng marshes.

sentences.zh: 雲夢不知其王也，射傷王。

translations.literal: Yun Meng did not know their wang and shot, wounding the wang.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Yunmeng did not recognize their king and shot at him, wounding him.

sentences.zh: 王走鄖。

translations.literal: The wang fled to Yun.
translations.idiomatic: The king fled to Yun.

sentences.zh: 鄖公之弟懷曰：「平王殺吾父，今我殺其子，不亦可乎？」

translations.literal: Yun gong younger brother Huai said: 'Ping Wang killed my father, now I kill his son, not also fitting?'
translations.idiomatic: Yun gong's younger brother Huai said: 'Ping Wang killed my father. Now I will kill his son. Is this not fitting?'

sentences.zh: 鄖公止之，然恐其弒昭王，乃與王出奔隨。

translations.literal: Yun gong stopped him, but feared he would assassinate Zhao Wang. He then fled out with the wang to Sui.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Yun sheltered him, but fearing assassination plots against King Zhao, he fled with the king to Sui.

sentences.zh: 吳王聞昭王往，即進擊隨，謂隨人曰：「周之子孫封於江漢之閒者，楚盡滅之。」

translations.literal: Wu wang heard Zhao Wang went, immediately advanced attacked Sui, told Sui people said: 'Zhou descendants enfeoffed between Jiang Han, Chu completely extinguished them.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wu wang heard Zhao Wang had gone and immediately advanced to attack Sui. He told the Sui people: 'Zhou's descendants enfeoffed between the Jiang and Han - Chu completely extinguished them.'

sentences.zh: 欲殺昭王。

translations.literal: He desired to kill Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He intended to kill King Zhao.

sentences.zh: 王從臣子綦乃深匿王，自以為王，謂隨人曰：「以我予吳。」

translations.literal: Wang follower Zi Qi then deeply hid wang, self pretended wang, told Sui people said: 'Give me to Wu.'
translations.idiomatic: The wang's follower Zi Qi then deeply hid the wang. He pretended to be the wang himself and told the Sui people: 'Give me to Wu.'

sentences.zh: 隨人卜予吳，不吉，乃謝吳王曰：「昭王亡，不在隨。」

translations.literal: Sui people divined give to Wu, not auspicious, then apologized Wu wang said: 'Zhao Wang fled, not in Sui.'
translations.idiomatic: The Sui people divined about giving to Wu. It was not auspicious. They then apologized to the Wu wang: 'Zhao Wang fled. He is not in Sui.'

sentences.zh: 吳請入自索之，隨不聽，吳亦罷去。

translations.literal: Wu requested to enter and search for him themselves. Sui did not listen. Wu also dismissed and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Wu demanded to enter and search for him themselves. Sui refused. Wu then withdrew.

sentences.zh: 昭王之出郢也，使申鮑胥請救於秦。

translations.literal: When Zhao Wang fled Ying, he sent Shen Bao Xu to request aid from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: When King Zhao fled Ying, he sent Shen Baoxu to seek aid from Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦以車五百乘救楚，楚亦收餘散兵，與秦擊吳。

translations.literal: Qin sent five hundred chariots to save Chu. Chu also gathered their remaining scattered troops and attacked Wu together with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent five hundred chariots to rescue Chu. Chu also rallied their remaining scattered troops and joined Qin in attacking Wu.

sentences.zh: 十一年六月，敗吳於稷。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, sixth month, they defeated Wu at Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of the eleventh year, they defeated Wu at Ji.

sentences.zh: 會吳王弟夫概見吳王兵傷敗，乃亡歸，自立為王。

translations.literal: Fu Gai, the Wu wang's younger brother, saw that the Wu wang's troops were wounded and defeated. He then fled back and established himself as wang.
translations.idiomatic: Meanwhile, Fugai, the Wu king's younger brother, saw that the Wu king's army was wounded and defeated. He fled back home and proclaimed himself king.

sentences.zh: 闔閭聞之，引兵去楚，歸擊夫概。

translations.literal: He Lu heard this and led troops to depart from Chu. He returned to attack Fu Gai.
translations.idiomatic: Helü heard of this and led his troops away from Chu to return and attack Fugai.

sentences.zh: 夫概敗，奔楚，楚封之堂谿，號為堂谿氏。

translations.literal: Fu Gai was defeated and fled to Chu. Chu enfeoffed him at Tang Xi and called him the Tang Xi clan.
translations.idiomatic: Fugai was defeated and fled to Chu. Chu enfeoffed him at Tangxi, and he became known as the Tangxi clan.

sentences.zh: 楚昭王滅唐九月，歸入郢。

translations.literal: Chu Zhao Wang extinguished Tang after nine months and returned to enter Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Nine months after King Zhao of Chu destroyed Tang, he returned to reenter Ying.

sentences.zh: 十二年，吳復伐楚，取番。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Wu again attacked Chu and took Fan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Wu attacked Chu again and captured Fan.

sentences.zh: 楚恐，去郢，北徙都鄀。

translations.literal: Chu feared and departed from Ying. They moved the capital north to Dui.
translations.idiomatic: Chu, in fear, abandoned Ying and moved their capital north to Dui.

sentences.zh: 十六年，孔子相魯。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Confucius became prime minister of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Confucius became prime minister of Lu.

sentences.zh: 二十年，楚滅頓，滅胡。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Chu extinguished Dun and extinguished Hu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Chu destroyed Dun and destroyed Hu.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，吳王闔閭伐越。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Wu wang He Lu attacked Yue.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, King Helü of Wu attacked Yue.

sentences.zh: 越王句踐射傷吳王，遂死。

translations.literal: Yue wang Gou Jian shot and wounded the Wu wang, who then died.
translations.idiomatic: King Goujian of Yue shot and wounded the Wu king, who then died.

sentences.zh: 吳由此怨越而不西伐楚。

translations.literal: Wu therefore resented Yue and did not attack Chu to the west.
translations.idiomatic: Wu therefore bore a grudge against Yue and did not attack Chu to the west.

sentences.zh: 二十七年春，吳伐陳，楚昭王救之，軍城父。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, spring, Wu attacked Chen. Chu Zhao Wang saved it and camped at Cheng Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the twenty-seventh year, Wu attacked Chen. King Zhao of Chu came to its rescue and camped at Chengfu.

sentences.zh: 十月，昭王病於軍中，有赤雲如鳥，夾日而蜚。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, Zhao Wang fell ill in the army camp. There were red clouds like a bird that flanked the sun and flew.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, King Zhao fell ill in the army camp. Red clouds shaped like a bird flanked the sun and flew.

sentences.zh: 昭王問周太史，太史曰：「是害於楚王，然可移於將相。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang asked Zhou grand astrologer, grand astrologer said: 'This harms Chu wang, however can shift to generals ministers.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Wang asked the Zhou grand astrologer. The grand astrologer said: 'This harms the Chu wang, but it can be shifted to the generals and ministers.'

sentences.zh: 將相聞是言，乃請自以身禱於神。

translations.literal: The generals and ministers heard these words and then requested to pray to the spirits with their own bodies.
translations.idiomatic: The generals and ministers heard these words and requested to offer themselves in prayer to the spirits.

sentences.zh: 昭王曰：「將相，孤之股肱也，今移禍，庸去是身乎！」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang said: 'Generals ministers, orphan's limbs, now shift calamity, how abandon these bodies!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Wang said: 'Generals and ministers are the orphan's limbs. Now to shift the calamity - how could I abandon these bodies!'

sentences.zh: 弗聽。

translations.literal: He did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He refused.

sentences.zh: 卜而河為祟，大夫請禱河。

translations.literal: They divined and the River caused calamity. The grandees requested to pray to the River.
translations.idiomatic: They divined and found the River was causing the calamity. The ministers requested to pray to the River.

sentences.zh: 昭王曰：「自吾先王受封，望不過江、漢，而河非所獲罪也。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang said: 'Since my former wang received enfeoffment, gaze not exceeded Jiang, Han, and River not what obtained crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Wang said: 'Since my former wang received enfeoffment, our gaze has not exceeded the Jiang and Han. The River is not what we have obtained crime against.'

sentences.zh: 止不許。

translations.literal: He stopped and did not permit it.
translations.idiomatic: He put a stop to it and did not allow it.

sentences.zh: 孔子在陳，聞是言，曰：「楚昭王通大道矣。

translations.literal: Confucius in Chen, heard these words, said: 'Chu Zhao Wang penetrated great way.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius was in Chen. He heard these words and said: 'Chu Zhao Wang penetrated the great way.

sentences.zh: 其不失國，宜哉！」

translations.literal: His not lose state, fitting!'
translations.idiomatic: That he does not lose his state is fitting!'

sentences.zh: 昭王病甚，乃召諸公子大夫曰：「孤不佞，再辱楚國之師，今乃得以天壽終，孤之幸也。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang illness severe, then summoned various gong zi grandees said: 'Orphan not talented, twice humiliated Chu state troops, now able to with heaven longevity end, orphan's fortune.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Wang's illness was severe. He then summoned the various gong zi and grandees: 'The orphan is not talented. I twice humiliated Chu state's troops. Now I am able to end with heaven's longevity. This is the orphan's fortune.'

sentences.zh: 讓其弟公子申為王，不可。

translations.literal: He yielded to his younger brother Gong zi Shen to be wang, but it was not possible.
translations.idiomatic: He yielded the throne to his younger brother Prince Shen, but it was not accepted.

sentences.zh: 又讓次弟公子結，亦不可。

translations.literal: He again yielded to his next younger brother Gong zi Jie, but it was also not possible.
translations.idiomatic: He again yielded to his next younger brother Prince Jie, but that too was unacceptable.

sentences.zh: 乃又讓次弟公子閭，五讓，乃後許為王。

translations.literal: He then again yielded to his next younger brother Gong zi Lv. After five yields, he was afterward permitted to be wang.
translations.idiomatic: He then yielded again to his next younger brother Prince Lü. After five refusals, he was finally allowed to become king.

sentences.zh: 將戰，庚寅，昭王卒於軍中。

translations.literal: About to battle, on Geng Yin, Zhao Wang died in the army camp.
translations.idiomatic: Just before battle, on the day Gengyin, King Zhao died in the army camp.

sentences.zh: 子閭曰：「王病甚，捨其子讓群臣，臣所以許王，以廣王意也。

translations.literal: Zi Lv said: 'Wang illness severe, abandoned his son yielded to group ministers, minister so permitted wang, to broaden wang intent.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lv said: 'The wang's illness was severe. He abandoned his son and yielded to the group of ministers. The minister permitted the wang to broaden the wang's intent.

sentences.zh: 今君王卒，臣豈敢忘君王之意乎！」

translations.literal: Now lord wang died, minister how dare forget lord wang intent!'
translations.idiomatic: Now the lord wang has died. How dare the minister forget the lord wang's intent!'

sentences.zh: 乃與子西、子綦謀，伏師閉涂，迎越女之子章立之，是為惠王。

translations.literal: He then planned with Zi Xi and Zi Qi. They hid troops and closed the roads. They welcomed the Yue woman's son Zhang and established him. This was Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He then plotted with Zixi and Ziqi. They hid troops and blocked the roads. They welcomed Zhang, son of the Yue woman, and established him as king. He became King Hui.

sentences.zh: 然後罷兵歸，葬昭王。

translations.literal: They then dismissed the troops and returned. They buried Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: They then disbanded the army and returned home. They buried King Zhao.

sentences.zh: 惠王二年，子西召故平王太子建之子勝於吳，以為巢大夫，號曰白公。

translations.literal: In Hui Wang's second year, Zi Xi summoned the former Ping Wang crown prince Jian's son Sheng from Wu. He made him the Chao grandee and called him White Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In King Hui's second year, Zixi summoned Sheng, son of the former Crown Prince Jian of King Ping, from Wu. He made him magistrate of Chao, where he became known as White Duke.

sentences.zh: 白公好兵而下士，欲報仇。

translations.literal: White Gong loved troops and lowered himself to scholars. He desired to avenge.
translations.idiomatic: White Duke loved military affairs and treated scholars with respect. He sought revenge.

sentences.zh: 六年，白公請兵令尹子西伐鄭。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, White Gong requested troops from Ling Yin Zi Xi to attack Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, White Duke requested troops from Prime Minister Zixi to attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 初，白公父建亡在鄭，鄭殺之，白公亡走吳，子西復召之，故以此怨鄭，欲伐之。

translations.literal: Initially, White Gong's father Jian fled and was in Zheng. Zheng killed him. White Gong fled to Wu. Zi Xi summoned him again. Therefore he resented Zheng with this and desired to attack it.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, White Duke's father Jian had fled to Zheng, where Zheng killed him. White Duke fled to Wu. Zixi summoned him back. Therefore he bore a grudge against Zheng and wished to attack it.

sentences.zh: 子西許而未為發兵。

translations.literal: Zi Xi permitted it but did not yet mobilize troops.
translations.idiomatic: Zixi agreed but did not yet mobilize the troops.

sentences.zh: 八年，晉伐鄭，鄭告急楚，楚使子西救鄭，受賂而去。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Jin attacked Zheng. Zheng reported urgent to Chu. Chu sent Zi Xi to save Zheng, but he received a bribe and departed.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Jin attacked Zheng. Zheng urgently appealed to Chu for help. Chu sent Zixi to rescue Zheng, but he took a bribe and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 白公勝怒，乃遂與勇力死士石乞等襲殺令尹子西、子綦於朝，因劫惠王，置之高府，欲弒之。

translations.literal: White Gong Sheng was angered. He then, with brave and strong dead soldiers like Shi Qi, surprise killed Ling Yin Zi Xi and Zi Qi at court. Therefore he kidnapped Hui Wang and placed him at the high office, desiring to assassinate him.
translations.idiomatic: White Duke Sheng was furious. He then, together with brave warriors like Shi Qi, assassinated Prime Minister Zixi and Ziqi in the court. He kidnapped King Hui and confined him in the high office, intending to kill him.

sentences.zh: 惠王從者屈固負王亡走昭王夫人宮。

translations.literal: Hui Wang's follower Qu Gu carried the wang and fled to Zhao Wang's lady's palace.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui's attendant Qu Gu carried the king on his back and fled to the palace of King Zhao's consort.

sentences.zh: 白公自立為王。

translations.literal: White Gong established himself as wang.
translations.idiomatic: White Duke proclaimed himself king.

sentences.zh: 月餘，會葉公來救楚，楚惠王之徒與共攻白公，殺之。

translations.literal: More than a month later, Ye Gong came to save Chu. Chu Hui Wang's followers attacked White Gong together with him and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: More than a month later, Lord Ye came to rescue Chu. King Hui's followers joined him in attacking White Duke and killed him.

sentences.zh: 惠王乃復位。

translations.literal: Hui Wang then restored his position.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui then regained his throne.

sentences.zh: 是歲也，滅陳而縣之。

translations.literal: This year, they extinguished Chen and made it a county.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, they destroyed Chen and converted it into a county.

sentences.zh: 十三年，吳王夫差彊，陵齊、晉，來伐楚。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Wu wang Fu Chai was strong. He overawed Qi and Jin and came to attack Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, King Fuchai of Wu was powerful. He intimidated Qi and Jin and came to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 十六年，越滅吳。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Yue extinguished Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Yue destroyed Wu.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，楚滅蔡。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, Chu extinguished Cai.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Chu destroyed Cai.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，楚滅杞。

translations.literal: In the forty-fourth year, Chu extinguished Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fourth year, Chu destroyed Qi.

sentences.zh: 與秦平。

translations.literal: They made peace with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: They made peace with Qin.

sentences.zh: 是時越已滅吳而不能正江、淮北；

translations.literal: At this time Yue already extinguished Wu but could not control Jiang, Huai north;
translations.idiomatic: At this time Yue had already extinguished Wu but could not control the Jiang and Huai north;

sentences.zh: 楚東侵，廣地至泗上。

translations.literal: Chu invaded east and broadened its land to the Si upper.
translations.idiomatic: Chu expanded eastward, extending its territory to the region along the Si River.

sentences.zh: 五十七年，惠王卒，子簡王中立。

translations.literal: In the fifty-seventh year, Hui Wang died, and his son Jian Wang Zhong was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-seventh year, King Hui died, and his son Zhong ascended the throne as King Jian.

sentences.zh: 簡王元年，北伐滅莒。

translations.literal: In Jian Wang's first year, they attacked north and extinguished Ju.
translations.idiomatic: In King Jian's first year, they attacked northward and destroyed Ju.

sentences.zh: 八年，魏文侯、韓武子、趙桓子始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Wei Wen Hou, Han Wu Zi, and Zhao Zhuan Zi began to be listed as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Marquis Wen of Wei, Lord Wu of Han, and Lord Zhuan of Zhao were first recognized as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，簡王卒，子聲王當立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Jian Wang died, and his son Sheng Wang Dang was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, King Jian died, and his son Dang ascended the throne as King Sheng.

sentences.zh: 聲王六年，盜殺聲王，子悼王熊疑立。

translations.literal: In Sheng Wang's sixth year, a robber killed Sheng Wang, and his son Dao Wang Xiong Yi was established.
translations.idiomatic: In King Sheng's sixth year, a robber assassinated King Sheng, and his son Xiong Yi ascended the throne as King Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼王二年，三晉來伐楚，至乘丘而還。

translations.literal: In Dao Wang's second year, the three Jin came to attack Chu, arrived at Cheng Qiu, and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In King Dao's second year, the three Jin states attacked Chu, reached Chengqiu, and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 四年，楚伐周。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Chu attacked Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Chu attacked Zhou.

sentences.zh: 鄭殺子陽。

translations.literal: Zheng killed Zi Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng killed Ziyang.

sentences.zh: 九年，伐韓，取負黍。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, they attacked Han and took Fu Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, they attacked Han and captured Fushu.

sentences.zh: 十一年，三晉伐楚，敗我大梁、榆關。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, the three Jin attacked Chu and defeated our Da Liang and Yu Guan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, the three Jin states attacked Chu and defeated our forces at Daliang and Yuguan.

sentences.zh: 楚厚賂秦，與之平。

translations.literal: Chu heavily bribed Qin and made peace with them.
translations.idiomatic: Chu paid heavy tribute to Qin and made peace with them.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，悼王卒，子肅王臧立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Dao Wang died, and his son Su Wang Zang was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, King Dao died, and his son Zang ascended the throne as King Su.

sentences.zh: 肅王四年，蜀伐楚，取茲方。

translations.literal: In Su Wang's fourth year, Shu attacked Chu and took Ci Fang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Su's fourth year, Shu attacked Chu and captured Cifang.

sentences.zh: 於是楚為捍關以距之。

translations.literal: Thereupon Chu made a defense pass to block them.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Chu built defensive passes to block them.

sentences.zh: 十年，魏取我魯陽。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Wei took our Lu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Wei captured our Luyang.

sentences.zh: 十一年，肅王卒，無子，立其弟熊良夫，是為宣王。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Su Wang died with no sons. They established his younger brother Xiong Liang Fu. This was Xuan Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, King Su died without heirs. They established his younger brother Xiong Liangfu as king. He became King Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣王六年，周天子賀秦獻公。

translations.literal: In Xuan Wang's sixth year, the Zhou heavenly son congratulated Qin Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In King Xuan's sixth year, the Zhou Son of Heaven congratulated Duke Xian of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦始復彊，而三晉益大，魏惠王、齊威王尤彊。

translations.literal: Qin began to be strong again, and the three Jin became increasingly great. Wei Hui Wang and Qi Wei Wang were especially strong.
translations.idiomatic: Qin began to regain its strength, and the three Jin states grew increasingly powerful. King Hui of Wei and King Wei of Qi were especially strong.

sentences.zh: 三十年，秦封衛鞅於商，南侵楚。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, Qin enfeoffed Wei Yang at Shang and invaded Chu to the south.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Qin enfeoffed Wei Yang at Shang and invaded Chu from the south.

sentences.zh: 是年，宣王卒，子威王熊商立。

translations.literal: This year, Xuan Wang died, and his son Wei Wang Xiong Shang was established.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, King Xuan died, and his son Xiong Shang ascended the throne as King Wei.

sentences.zh: 威王六年，周顯王致文武胙於秦惠王。

translations.literal: In Wei Wang's sixth year, Zhou Xian Wang presented Wen and Wu offerings to Qin Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wei's sixth year, King Xian of Zhou presented the Wen and Wu sacrificial meats to King Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 七年，齊孟嘗君父田嬰欺楚，楚威王伐齊，敗之於徐州，而令齊必逐田嬰。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Qi Meng Chang Jun's father Tian Ying deceived Chu. Chu Wei Wang attacked Qi, defeated them at Xu Zhou, and commanded that Qi must expel Tian Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Tian Ying, father of Lord Mengchang of Qi, deceived Chu. King Wei of Chu attacked Qi, defeated them at Xuzhou, and commanded that Qi must expel Tian Ying.

sentences.zh: 田嬰恐，張丑偽謂楚王曰：「王所以戰勝於徐州者，田盼子不用也。

translations.literal: Tian Ying feared, Zhang Chou falsely told Chu wang said: 'Wang reason for victory at Xu Zhou was Tian Pan Zi not used.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Ying feared. Zhang Chou falsely told the Chu wang: 'The wang's reason for victory at Xu Zhou was that Tian Pan Zi was not used.

sentences.zh: 盼子者，有功於國，而百姓為之用。

translations.literal: Pan Zi had merit for the state, and the common people were used for him.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Pan had merit for the state, and the people served him loyally.

sentences.zh: 嬰子弗善而用申紀。

translations.literal: Ying's son was not good and used Shen Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Ying's son was incompetent and employed Shen Ji.

sentences.zh: 申紀者，大臣不附，百姓不為用，故王勝之也。

translations.literal: Shen Ji - ministers were not attached to him, common people were not used for him. Therefore the wang defeated him.
translations.idiomatic: As for Shen Ji, the ministers did not support him and the people would not serve him. Therefore the king defeated him.

sentences.zh: 今王逐嬰子，嬰子逐，盼子必用矣。

translations.literal: Now if the wang expels Ying's son, and Ying's son is expelled, Pan Zi will certainly be used.
translations.idiomatic: If the king now expels Ying's son, once he's expelled, Lord Pan will certainly be appointed.

sentences.zh: 復搏其士卒以與王遇，必不便於王矣。」

translations.literal: Again gather their officers soldiers to meet wang, certainly inconvenient for wang.'
translations.idiomatic: He will again gather their officers and soldiers to meet the wang. This will certainly be inconvenient for the wang.'

sentences.zh: 楚王因弗逐也。

translations.literal: The Chu wang therefore did not expel him.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu therefore did not expel him.

sentences.zh: 十一年，威王卒，子懷王熊槐立。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Wei Wang died, and his son Huai Wang Xiong Huai was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, King Wei died, and his son Xiong Huai ascended the throne as King Huai.

sentences.zh: 魏聞楚喪，伐楚，取我陘山。

translations.literal: Wei heard of Chu's mourning and attacked Chu, taking our Xing Shan.
translations.idiomatic: Wei heard of Chu's mourning and attacked Chu, capturing our Mount Xing.

sentences.zh: 懷王元年，張儀始相秦惠王。

translations.literal: In Huai Wang's first year, Zhang Yi began as prime minister to Qin Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Huai's first year, Zhang Yi first became prime minister to King Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 四年，秦惠王初稱王。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Qin Hui Wang first called himself wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, King Hui of Qin first proclaimed himself king.

sentences.zh: 六年，楚使柱國昭陽將兵而攻魏，破之於襄陵，得八邑。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Chu sent Zhu Guo Zhao Yang to lead troops and attack Wei. He broke them at Xiang Ling and obtained eight towns.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Chu sent Grandee Zhaoyang to lead troops against Wei. He defeated them at Xiangling and captured eight cities.

sentences.zh: 又移兵而攻齊，齊王患之。

translations.literal: He again shifted troops to attack Qi, and the Qi wang was worried.
translations.idiomatic: He then shifted his troops to attack Qi, and the King of Qi was alarmed.

sentences.zh: 陳軫適為秦使齊，齊王曰：「為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Chen Zhen just as Qin envoy Qi, Qi wang said: 'Do for it what?'
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen was just serving as Qin's envoy to Qi. The Qi wang said: 'What should we do about it?'

sentences.zh: 陳軫曰：「王勿憂，請令罷之。」

translations.literal: Chen Zhen said: 'Wang do not worry, please command stop it.'
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen said: 'Wang, do not worry. Please command to stop it.'

sentences.zh: 即往見昭陽軍中，曰：「願聞楚國之法，破軍殺將者何以貴之？」

translations.literal: Immediately went saw Zhao Yang army middle, said: 'Wish hear Chu state law, break army kill general how reward?'
translations.idiomatic: He immediately went and saw Zhao Yang in the army camp, saying: 'I wish to hear about Chu state's law. How do they reward someone who breaks an army and kills a general?'

sentences.zh: 昭陽曰：「其官為上柱國，封上爵執珪。」

translations.literal: Zhao Yang said: 'His office becomes upper pillar state, enfeoffed upper rank holds jade tablet.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang said: 'His office becomes upper pillar state, enfeoffed with upper rank holding a jade tablet.'

sentences.zh: 陳軫曰：「其有貴於此者乎？」

translations.literal: Chen Zhen said: 'Is there honor greater than this?'
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen said, 'Is there any honor greater than this?'

sentences.zh: 昭陽曰：「令尹。」

translations.literal: Zhao Yang said: 'Ling Yin.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhaoyang said, 'Prime minister.'

sentences.zh: 陳軫曰：「今君已為令尹矣，此國冠之上。

translations.literal: Chen Zhen said: 'Now lord already Ling Yin, this state crown above.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen said: 'Now the lord is already Ling Yin. This is above the state's crown.

sentences.zh: 臣請得譬之。

translations.literal: Minister please get parable it.'
translations.idiomatic: Minister, please allow me to parable it.'

sentences.zh: 人有遺其舍人一卮酒者，舍人相謂曰：『數人飲此，不足以遍，請遂畫地為蛇，蛇先成者獨飲之。』

translations.literal: Someone left his attendants one cup wine, attendants mutually said: 'Several people drink this, not sufficient circulate, please then draw ground for snake, snake first complete alone drink it.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone left his attendants one cup of wine. The attendants said to each other: 'Several people drinking this is not sufficient to go around. Please then draw on the ground for a snake. The snake that is first completed will drink it alone.'

sentences.zh: 一人曰：『吾蛇先成。』

translations.literal: One person said: 'My snake first complete.'
translations.idiomatic: One person said: 'My snake is first complete.'

sentences.zh: 舉酒而起，曰：『吾能為之足。』

translations.literal: Raised wine rose, said: 'I can for it feet.'
translations.idiomatic: He raised the wine and rose, saying: 'I can make feet for it.'

sentences.zh: 及其為之足，而後成人奪之酒而飲之，曰：『蛇固無足，今為之足，是非蛇也。』

translations.literal: When reached made feet for it, then other person seized wine drank it, said: 'Snake originally no feet, now made feet for it, this not snake.'
translations.idiomatic: When he had made feet for it, then another person seized the wine and drank it, saying: 'A snake originally has no feet. Now making feet for it - this is not a snake.'

sentences.zh: 今君相楚而攻魏，破軍殺將，功莫大焉，冠之上不可以加矣。

translations.literal: Now the lord as prime minister of Chu attacked Wei, broke the army and killed the general. No merit is greater. Nothing can be added above the crown.
translations.idiomatic: Now you serve as Chu's prime minister and attacked Wei, routing their army and killing their general. No achievement is greater. Nothing can be added to surpass this crown.

sentences.zh: 今又移兵而攻齊，攻齊勝之，官爵不加於此；

translations.literal: Now again shift troops attack Qi, attack Qi win it, office rank not add to this;
translations.idiomatic: Now again shifting troops to attack Qi, if attacking Qi and winning it, office and rank will not be added to this;

sentences.zh: 攻之不勝，身死爵奪，有毀於楚：此為蛇為足之說也。

translations.literal: Attack not win, body die rank seize, have harm to Chu: this for snake make feet saying.
translations.idiomatic: Attacking and not winning, body dies and rank is seized, brings harm to Chu: this is the saying of making feet for the snake.

sentences.zh: 不若引兵而去以德齊，此持滿之術也。」

translations.literal: Not if lead troops depart bestow virtue Qi, this hold full technique.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to lead troops away and bestow virtue on Qi. This is the technique of holding when full.'

sentences.zh: 昭陽曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Zhao Yang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhaoyang said, 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 引兵而去。

translations.literal: He led troops and departed.
translations.idiomatic: He led his troops and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 燕、韓君初稱王。

translations.literal: The Yan and Han lords first called themselves wang.
translations.idiomatic: The rulers of Yan and Han first proclaimed themselves kings.

sentences.zh: 秦使張儀與楚、齊、魏相會，盟齧桑。

translations.literal: Qin sent Zhang Yi to meet with Chu, Qi, and Wei. They allied at Nie Sang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent Zhang Yi to meet with Chu, Qi, and Wei. They formed an alliance at Niesang.

sentences.zh: 十一年，蘇秦約從山東六國共攻秦，楚懷王為從長。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Su Qin allied the six states east of the mountains to together attack Qin. Chu Huai Wang was the alliance leader.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Su Qin formed a vertical alliance of the six eastern states to attack Qin together. King Huai of Chu served as the alliance leader.

sentences.zh: 至函谷關，秦出兵擊六國，六國兵皆引而歸，齊獨後。

translations.literal: They arrived at Han Gu pass. Qin sent troops to attack the six states. The six states' troops all withdrew and returned. Qi was alone and later.
translations.idiomatic: They advanced to the Hangu Pass. Qin sent troops to counterattack the six states. All six states' armies withdrew and returned home. Only Qi remained behind.

sentences.zh: 十二年，齊湣王伐敗趙、魏軍，秦亦伐敗韓，與齊爭長。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Qi Min Wang attacked and defeated the Zhao and Wei armies. Qin also attacked and defeated Han. They contended for leadership with Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, King Min of Qi attacked and defeated the armies of Zhao and Wei. Qin also attacked and defeated Han. They vied for supremacy with Qi.

sentences.zh: 十六年，秦欲伐齊，而楚與齊從親，秦惠王患之，乃宣言張儀免相，使張儀南見楚王，謂楚王曰：「敝邑之王所甚說者無先大王，雖儀之所甚願為門闌之廝者亦無先大王。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Qin desired attack Qi, but Chu with Qi allied close, Qin Hui Wang worried it, then proclaimed Zhang Yi dismissed prime minister, sent Zhang Yi south saw Chu wang, told Chu wang said: 'My humble state's wang what very pleases has none before great wang, though Yi what very wishes to be gate barrier servant also none before great wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Qin desired to attack Qi, but Chu was allied closely with Qi. Qin Hui Wang was worried about it. He then proclaimed that Zhang Yi was dismissed as prime minister and sent Zhang Yi south to see the Chu wang. He told the Chu wang: 'What pleases my humble state's wang most has none before the great wang. Though what I most wish to be is a gate barrier servant, there is also none before the great wang.

sentences.zh: 敝邑之王所甚憎者無先齊王，雖儀之所甚憎者亦無先齊王。

translations.literal: What my humble state wang hates most has none before the Qi wang. Though what I hate most also has none before the Qi wang.
translations.idiomatic: There is nothing my humble state's king hates more than the King of Qi. Even I, Zhang Yi, hate no one more than the King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 而大王和之，是以敝邑之王不得事王，而令儀亦不得為門闌之廝也。

translations.literal: But the great wang allies with him. Therefore my humble state wang cannot serve the wang, and causes Yi also cannot be a gate barrier servant.
translations.idiomatic: But Your Majesty allies with him. Therefore my humble state's king cannot serve Your Majesty, and even I, Zhang Yi, cannot serve as the lowliest gatekeeper.

sentences.zh: 王為儀閉關而絕齊，今使使者從儀西取笔秦所分楚商於之地方六百里，如是則齊弱矣。

translations.literal: The wang, for Yi, closes the pass and cuts off Qi. Now sending an envoy to follow Yi west to take the brush - the land of six hundred li that Qin divided from Chu at Shang Yu. Like this, then Qi will be weak.
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty, for my sake, has closed the passes and severed relations with Qi. Now send an envoy to follow me west and reclaim the 600 li of territory that Qin took from Chu at Shangyu. This will weaken Qi.

sentences.zh: 是北弱齊，西德於秦，私商於以為富，此一計而三利俱至也。」

translations.literal: This north weakens Qi, west virtue to Qin, privately Shang Yu as wealth, this one plan three benefits all arrive.'
translations.idiomatic: This weakens Qi to the north, shows virtue to Qin to the west, privately uses Shang Yu as wealth. This one plan brings three benefits all together.'

sentences.zh: 懷王大悅，乃置相璽於張儀，日與置酒，宣言「吾復得吾商於之地」。

translations.literal: Huai Wang greatly pleased, then placed prime minister seal on Zhang Yi, daily with him set wine, proclaimed 'I again obtain my Shang Yu land.'
translations.idiomatic: Huai Wang was greatly pleased. He then placed the prime minister seal on Zhang Yi and daily set wine with him, proclaiming 'I again obtain my Shang Yu land.'

sentences.zh: 群臣皆賀，而陳軫獨弔。

translations.literal: The group of ministers all congratulated, but Chen Zhen alone mourned.
translations.idiomatic: All the ministers congratulated him, but Chen Zhen alone offered condolences.

sentences.zh: 懷王曰：「何故？」

translations.literal: Huai Wang said: 'Why?'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai said, 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 陳軫對曰：「秦之所為重王者，以王之有齊也。

translations.literal: Chen Zhen answered said: 'Qin what for respects wang, because wang has Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen answered: 'Why Qin respects the wang is because the wang has Qi.

sentences.zh: 今地未可得而齊交先絕，是楚孤也。

translations.literal: Now the land is not yet obtainable but the Qi alliance is first cut off. This makes Chu isolated.
translations.idiomatic: Now we haven't obtained the land yet, but we've already severed our alliance with Qi. This isolates Chu.

sentences.zh: 夫秦又何重孤國哉，必輕楚矣。

translations.literal: Indeed, what does Qin respect about an isolated state? They will certainly slight Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, why would Qin respect an isolated state? They will certainly despise Chu.

sentences.zh: 且先出地而後絕齊，則秦計不為。

translations.literal: Moreover, if we first give the land and then cut off Qi, then Qin's plan will not work.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, if we first return the land and then sever ties with Qi, Qin's scheme will fail.

sentences.zh: 先絕齊而後責地，則必見欺於張儀。

translations.literal: If we first cut off Qi and then demand the land, we will certainly be deceived by Zhang Yi.
translations.idiomatic: If we first sever ties with Qi and then demand the land, we will certainly be deceived by Zhang Yi.

sentences.zh: 見欺於張儀，則王必怨之。

translations.literal: Being deceived by Zhang Yi, the wang will certainly resent it.
translations.idiomatic: Once deceived by Zhang Yi, Your Majesty will certainly resent it.

sentences.zh: 怨之，是西起秦患，北絕齊交。

translations.literal: Resenting it will raise Qin calamity to the west and cut off Qi alliance to the north.
translations.idiomatic: This resentment will stir up trouble with Qin in the west and sever our alliance with Qi in the north.

sentences.zh: 西起秦患，北絕齊交，則兩國之兵必至。

translations.literal: Raising Qin calamity to the west and cutting off Qi alliance to the north will cause both states' troops to certainly arrive.
translations.idiomatic: Trouble with Qin in the west and no alliance with Qi in the north will certainly bring the armies of both states against us.

sentences.zh: 臣故弔。」

translations.literal: Minister therefore mourn.'
translations.idiomatic: The minister therefore mourns.'

sentences.zh: 楚王弗聽，因使一將軍西受封地。

translations.literal: The Chu wang did not listen. He therefore sent one general west to receive the enfeoffed land.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu refused to listen. He sent one general west to receive the promised territory.

sentences.zh: 張儀至秦，詳醉墜車，稱病不出三月，地不可得。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi arrived at Qin. He pretended to be drunk and fell from his chariot. He claimed illness and did not come out for three months. The land was not obtainable.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi arrived in Qin. He pretended to be drunk and fell from his chariot. He claimed illness and remained secluded for three months. The land could not be obtained.

sentences.zh: 楚王曰：「儀以吾絕齊為尚薄邪？」

translations.literal: Chu wang said: 'Yi because I cut off Qi still considers thin?'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu wang said: 'Does Yi still consider it thin because I cut off Qi?'

sentences.zh: 乃使勇士宋遺北辱齊王。

translations.literal: He then sent the brave warrior Song Yi north to insult the Qi wang.
translations.idiomatic: He then sent the brave warrior Song Yi north to insult the King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王大怒，折楚符而合於秦。

translations.literal: The Qi wang was greatly angered. He broke the Chu tally and allied with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qi was furious. He broke the Chu alliance tally and formed an alliance with Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦齊交合，張儀乃起朝，謂楚將軍曰：「子何不受地？

translations.literal: Qin Qi allied, Zhang Yi then rose court, told Chu general said: 'You why not accept land?
translations.idiomatic: Qin and Qi allied. Zhang Yi then rose at court and told the Chu general: 'Why do you not accept the land?

sentences.zh: 從某至某，廣袤六里。」

translations.literal: From so-and-so to so-and-so, breadth length six li.'
translations.idiomatic: From such-and-such to such-and-such, it is six li in breadth and length.'

sentences.zh: 楚將軍曰：「臣之所以見命者六百里，不聞六里。」

translations.literal: Chu general said: 'Minister what received command six hundred li, not heard six li.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu general said: 'What the minister received command of was six hundred li. I have not heard of six li.'

sentences.zh: 即以歸報懷王。

translations.literal: He immediately returned with this and reported to Huai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He immediately returned and reported this to King Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷王大怒，興師將伐秦。

translations.literal: Huai Wang was greatly angered. He raised troops and was about to attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai was furious. He mobilized his army and prepared to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 陳軫又曰：「伐秦非計也。

translations.literal: Chen Zhen again said: 'Attacking Qin not plan.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen again said: 'Attacking Qin is not the plan.

sentences.zh: 不如因賂之一名都，與之伐齊，是我亡於秦，取償於齊也，吾國尚可全。

translations.literal: It would be better to bribe it with one famous city and attack Qi together with it. This way we lose to Qin but take compensation from Qi. Our state can still be preserved.
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to bribe Qin with one famous city and join them in attacking Qi. This way we lose territory to Qin but gain compensation from Qi. Our state can still survive.

sentences.zh: 今王已絕於齊而責欺於秦，是吾合秦齊之交而來天下之兵也，國必大傷矣。」

translations.literal: Now wang already cut off from Qi but demand deceived by Qin, this makes us unite Qin Qi alliance and bring world's troops, state certainly greatly harmed.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the wang has already cut off relations with Qi but is being deceived by Qin. This unites the Qin-Qi alliance and brings the world's troops against us. Our state will certainly be greatly harmed.'

sentences.zh: 楚王不聽，遂絕和於秦，發兵西攻秦。

translations.literal: The Chu wang did not listen. He then cut off peace with Qin and mobilized troops to attack Qin to the west.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu refused to listen. He broke off relations with Qin and mobilized troops to attack Qin in the west.

sentences.zh: 秦亦發兵擊之。

translations.literal: Qin also mobilized troops and attacked it.
translations.idiomatic: Qin also mobilized troops and counterattacked.

sentences.zh: 十七年春，與秦戰丹陽，秦大敗我軍，斬甲士八萬，虜我大將軍屈丐、裨將軍逢侯丑等七十餘人，遂取漢中之郡。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, spring, we battled with Qin at Dan Yang. Qin greatly defeated our army, beheaded eighty thousand armored soldiers, captured our grand general Qu Gai, deputy general Feng Hou Chou and more than seventy others, and then took the Han Zhong commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the seventeenth year, Chu fought Qin at Danyang. Qin decisively defeated our army, killing 80,000 armored soldiers, capturing our grand general Qu Gai, deputy general Feng Hou Chou, and more than seventy others, then seized the Han Zhong commandery.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王大怒，乃悉國兵復襲秦，戰於藍田，大敗楚軍。

translations.literal: Chu Huai Wang was greatly angered. He then sent all the state's troops to again attack Qin. They battled at Lan Tian and greatly defeated the Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai of Chu was furious. He mobilized all the state's troops for another attack on Qin. They fought at Lantian, where Qin decisively defeated the Chu army.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏聞楚之困，乃南襲楚，至於鄧。

translations.literal: Han, Wei heard Chu's distress, then south attacked Chu, reached Deng.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei heard of Chu's distress and then attacked south to Chu, reaching Deng.

sentences.zh: 楚聞，乃引兵歸。

translations.literal: Chu heard and then led the troops back.
translations.idiomatic: When Chu heard of this, they withdrew their troops.

sentences.zh: 十八年，秦使使約復與楚親，分漢中之半以和楚。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Qin sent an envoy who promised to again become close with Chu and divided half of Han Zhong to make peace with Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Qin sent an envoy promising to renew friendly relations with Chu and returned half of Han Zhong to make peace.

sentences.zh: 楚王曰：「願得張儀，不願得地。」

translations.literal: Chu wang said: 'Wish obtain Zhang Yi, not wish obtain land.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu wang said: 'I wish to obtain Zhang Yi, not the land.'

sentences.zh: 張儀聞之，請之楚。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi heard this and requested to go to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi heard of this and requested permission to go to Chu.

sentences.zh: 秦王曰：「楚且甘心於子，柰何？」

translations.literal: Qin wang said: 'Chu moreover content with you, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: The Qin wang said: 'Chu will moreover be content with you. What to do?'

sentences.zh: 張儀曰：「臣善其左右靳尚，靳尚又能得事於楚王幸姬鄭袖，袖所言無不從者。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi said: 'Minister friendly with his attendants Jin Shang, Jin Shang moreover can obtain service with Chu wang favored concubine Zheng Xiu, Xiu what said none not followed.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi said: 'I am friendly with his attendant Jin Shang. Jin Shang can moreover obtain service with the Chu wang's favored concubine Zheng Xiu. Whatever Xiu says is followed without fail.

sentences.zh: 且儀以前使負楚以商於之約，今秦楚大戰，有惡，臣非面自謝楚不解。

translations.literal: Moreover, I previously as envoy wronged Chu with the Shang Yu agreement. Now Qin and Chu have had a great battle with enmity. I must apologize to Chu in person to resolve it.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, I previously as envoy deceived Chu with the Shangyu agreement. Now Qin and Chu have fought a great battle and are enemies. I must apologize to Chu in person to resolve this.

sentences.zh: 且大王在，楚不宜敢取儀。

translations.literal: Moreover, with the great wang present, Chu would not dare to take Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, while Your Majesty is alive, Chu would not dare to harm me.

sentences.zh: 誠殺儀以便國，臣之願也。」

translations.literal: Truly kill Yi to benefit state, minister's wish.'
translations.idiomatic: Truly killing Yi to benefit the state is my wish.'

sentences.zh: 儀遂使楚。

translations.literal: Yi then went as envoy to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi then went as envoy to Chu.

sentences.zh: 至，懷王不見，因而囚張儀，欲殺之。

translations.literal: He arrived, but Huai Wang did not see him. Therefore he imprisoned Zhang Yi and desired to kill him.
translations.idiomatic: Upon arrival, King Huai refused to see him. Therefore he imprisoned Zhang Yi and intended to execute him.

sentences.zh: 儀私於靳尚，靳尚為請懷王曰：「拘張儀，秦王必怒。

translations.literal: Yi privately with Jin Shang, Jin Shang for requested Huai Wang said: 'Detain Zhang Yi, Qin wang certainly angry.
translations.idiomatic: Yi was privately friendly with Jin Shang. Jin Shang requested on his behalf to Huai Wang: 'Detaining Zhang Yi will certainly anger the Qin wang.

sentences.zh: 天下見楚無秦，必輕王矣。」

translations.literal: World sees Chu without Qin, certainly slight wang.'
translations.idiomatic: The world seeing Chu without Qin will certainly slight the wang.'

sentences.zh: 又謂夫人鄭袖曰：「秦王甚愛張儀，而王欲殺之，今將以上庸之地六縣賂楚，以美人聘楚王，以宮中善歌者為之媵。

translations.literal: Again told lady Zheng Xiu said: 'Qin wang very loves Zhang Yi, but wang desires kill him, now will with Shang Yong land six counties bribe Chu, with beauty betroth Chu wang, with palace good singers for attendants.
translations.idiomatic: He again told Lady Zheng Xiu: 'The Qin wang very much loves Zhang Yi, but the wang desires to kill him. Now he will bribe Chu with six counties of Shang Yong land, betroth the Chu wang with a beauty, and provide palace singers as attendants.

sentences.zh: 楚王重地，秦女必貴，而夫人必斥矣。

translations.literal: The Chu wang values land. The Qin woman will certainly be noble, but the lady will certainly be demoted.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu values territory. The Qin woman will certainly become noble, but you will certainly be demoted.

sentences.zh: 夫人不若言而出之。」

translations.literal: Lady not if speak release him.'
translations.idiomatic: The lady should speak and release him.'

sentences.zh: 鄭袖卒言張儀於王而出之。

translations.literal: Zheng Xiu finally spoke to the wang and had Zhang Yi released.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng Xiu finally spoke to the king and had Zhang Yi released.

sentences.zh: 儀出，懷王因善遇儀，儀因說楚王以叛從約而與秦合親，約婚姻。

translations.literal: Yi was released. Huai Wang therefore treated Yi well. Yi therefore persuaded the Chu wang to break the alliance agreement and become close with Qin, agreeing to marriage.
translations.idiomatic: Once released, King Huai treated Zhang Yi well. Zhang Yi then persuaded the King of Chu to break the alliance agreement and form close ties with Qin, agreeing to a marriage alliance.

sentences.zh: 張儀已去，屈原使從齊來，諫王曰：「何不誅張儀？」

translations.literal: Zhang Yi already departed, Qu Yuan envoy from Qi came, admonished wang said: 'Why not execute Zhang Yi?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi had already departed when Qu Yuan came as envoy from Qi. He admonished the wang: 'Why not execute Zhang Yi?'

sentences.zh: 懷王悔，使人追儀，弗及。

translations.literal: Huai Wang regretted it and sent people to pursue Yi, but they did not catch him.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai regretted his decision and sent people to pursue Zhang Yi, but they could not catch him.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦惠王卒。

translations.literal: This year, Qin Hui Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, King Hui of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 二十［六］年，齊湣王欲為從長，惡楚之與秦合，乃使使遺楚王書曰：「寡人患楚之不察於尊名也。

translations.literal: Twenty [six] year, Qi Min Wang desired be alliance leader, hated Chu's alliance with Qin, then sent envoy sent Chu wang letter said: 'I worry Chu not discern honorable name.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty [six]th year, Qi Min Wang desired to be the alliance leader. He hated Chu's alliance with Qin and sent an envoy with a letter to the Chu wang: 'I worry that Chu does not discern honorable reputation.

sentences.zh: 今秦惠王死，武王立，張儀走魏，樗裏疾、公孫衍用，而楚事秦。

translations.literal: Now Qin Hui Wang has died and Wu Wang is established. Zhang Yi has fled to Wei. Chu Li Ji and Gong Sun Yan are employed, but Chu serves Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Now King Hui of Qin has died and King Wu has ascended. Zhang Yi has fled to Wei. Chu Li Ji and Gong Sun Yan are in power, but Chu still serves Qin.

sentences.zh: 夫樗裏疾善乎韓，而公孫衍善乎魏；

translations.literal: Indeed Chu Li Ji friendly with Han, and Gong Sun Yan friendly with Wei;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed Chu Li Ji is friendly with Han, and Gong Sun Yan is friendly with Wei;

sentences.zh: 楚必事秦，韓、魏恐，必因二人求合於秦，則燕、趙亦宜事秦。

translations.literal: Chu will certainly serve Qin. Han and Wei will fear and certainly seek to unite with Qin through these two people. Then Yan and Zhao will also appropriately serve Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Chu will certainly serve Qin. Fearing this, Han and Wei will certainly seek alliance with Qin through these two men. Then Yan and Zhao will also appropriately serve Qin.

sentences.zh: 四國爭事秦，則楚為郡縣矣。

translations.literal: If four states contend to serve Qin, then Chu will become mere commanderies and counties.
translations.idiomatic: If four states compete to serve Qin, then Chu will become mere commanderies and counties.

sentences.zh: 王何不與寡人并力收韓、魏、燕、趙，與為從而尊周室，以案兵息民，令於天下？

translations.literal: Wang why not with I combine strength gather Han, Wei, Yan, Zhao, with them form alliance honor Zhou chamber, to quell troops rest people, command world?
translations.idiomatic: Why doesn't the wang combine strength with me to gather Han, Wei, Yan, and Zhao, form an alliance with them to honor the Zhou chamber, quell troops and rest the people, and command the world?

sentences.zh: 莫敢不樂聽，則王名成矣。

translations.literal: None will dare not to happily obey. Then the wang's reputation will be complete.
translations.idiomatic: No one will dare refuse. Your Majesty's reputation will be complete.

sentences.zh: 王率諸侯并伐，破秦必矣。

translations.literal: The wang leading the feudal lords in united attack will certainly break Qin.
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty leads the lords in a united attack, Qin will certainly be defeated.

sentences.zh: 王取武關、蜀、漢之地，私吳、越之富而擅江海之利，韓、魏割上黨，西薄函谷，則楚之彊百萬也。

translations.literal: The wang takes the lands of Wu Guan, Shu, and Han, privately enjoys Wu and Yue's wealth and monopolizes the Jiang and Hai profits. Han and Wei cede Shang Dang, and to the west approaches Han Gu. Then Chu's strength will be a million.
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty will take the lands of Wuguan, Shu, and Han. You will privately enjoy the wealth of Wu and Yue and monopolize the profits of the Jiang and Hai. Han and Wei will cede Shangdang, and to the west you will approach Hangu. Then Chu's strength will be a million strong.

sentences.zh: 且王欺於張儀，亡地漢中，兵銼藍田，天下莫不代王懷怒。

translations.literal: Moreover the wang was deceived by Zhang Yi, lost the land of Han Zhong, troops were worn at Lan Tian. The world none do not harbor anger on the wang's behalf.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Your Majesty was deceived by Zhang Yi, lost the land of Hanzhong, and suffered defeat at Lantian. The whole world harbors anger on Your Majesty's behalf.

sentences.zh: 今乃欲先事秦！

translations.literal: Now moreover desires first serve Qin!
translations.idiomatic: Now he moreover desires to serve Qin first!

sentences.zh: 願大王孰計之。」

translations.literal: Wish great wang carefully plan it.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish the great wang to carefully plan it.'

sentences.zh: 楚王業已欲和於秦，見齊王書，猶豫不決，下其議群臣。

translations.literal: The Chu wang already desired peace with Qin. He saw the Qi wang's letter and hesitated undecided. He put it to the group of ministers to discuss.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Chu already desired peace with Qin. When he saw the letter from the King of Qi, he hesitated undecided. He submitted it to his ministers for discussion.

sentences.zh: 群臣或言和秦，或曰聽齊。

translations.literal: The group of ministers some said to make peace with Qin, others said to listen to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Some ministers said to make peace with Qin, others said to heed Qi.

sentences.zh: 昭雎曰：「王雖東取地於越，不足以刷恥；

translations.literal: Zhao Ju said: 'Wang though east take land from Yue, not sufficient wash shame;
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ju said: 'Though the wang takes land to the east from Yue, it is not sufficient to wash away shame;

sentences.zh: 必且取地於秦，而後足以刷恥於諸侯。

translations.literal: He must moreover take land from Qin, and only then will it be sufficient to wash shame before the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: He must also take territory from Qin, only then will it be sufficient to wash away the shame before the other lords.

sentences.zh: 王不如深善齊、韓以重樗裏疾，如是則王得韓、齊之重以求地矣。

translations.literal: The wang should deeply befriend Qi and Han to give weight to Chu Li Ji. Like this, the wang will obtain Han and Qi's importance to seek land.
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty should deeply befriend Qi and Han to strengthen Chu Li Ji's position. This way, Your Majesty will gain the support of Han and Qi to demand territory.

sentences.zh: 秦破韓宜陽，而韓猶復事秦者，以先王墓在平陽，而秦之武遂去之七十里，以故尤畏秦。

translations.literal: Qin broke Han's Yi Yang, but Han still again served Qin because their former wang's tombs were in Ping Yang, and Qin's Wu Sui was only seventy li distant. Therefore they especially feared Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured Han's Yiyang, yet Han still continues to serve Qin because their ancestral tombs are in Pingyang, and Qin's Wusui is only seventy li away. Therefore they fear Qin especially.

sentences.zh: 不然，秦攻三川，趙攻上黨，楚攻河外，韓必亡。

translations.literal: Not so. If Qin attacks San Chuan, Zhao attacks Shang Dang, and Chu attacks He Wai, Han will certainly perish.
translations.idiomatic: Otherwise, if Qin attacks Sanchuan, Zhao attacks Shangdang, and Chu attacks Hewai, Han will certainly be destroyed.

sentences.zh: 楚之救韓，不能使韓不亡，然存韓者楚也。

translations.literal: Chu's saving of Han cannot make Han not perish, however the one who preserves Han is Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's rescue of Han cannot prevent Han's destruction, yet the one who preserves Han is Chu.

sentences.zh: 韓已得武遂於秦，以河山為塞，所報德莫如楚厚，臣以為其事王必疾。

translations.literal: Han has already obtained Wu Sui from Qin, using river and mountains as a barrier. What repays virtue is none thicker than Chu. The minister thinks they will serve the wang certainly quickly.
translations.idiomatic: Han has already obtained Wusui from Qin, using rivers and mountains as barriers. No one repays virtue more generously than Chu. I believe they will serve Your Majesty with great haste.

sentences.zh: 齊之所信於韓者，以韓公子眛為齊相也。

translations.literal: What Qi is trusted by Han is because Han gong zi Mei serves as Qi's prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: What gives Qi credibility with Han is that Prince Mei of Han serves as Qi's prime minister.

sentences.zh: 韓已得武遂於秦，王甚善之，使之以齊、韓重樗裏疾，疾得齊、韓之重，其主弗敢棄疾也。

translations.literal: Han has already obtained Wu Sui from Qin. The wang very befriended it and sent it with Qi and Han's weight to Chu Li Ji. Ji obtained Qi and Han's weight. His master does not dare abandon Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Han has already obtained Wusui from Qin. Your Majesty treated it very favorably and sent it together with the influence of Qi and Han to Chu Li Ji. Ji gained the support of Qi and Han. His master does not dare abandon Ji.

sentences.zh: 今又益之以楚之重，樗里子必言秦，復與楚之侵地矣。」

translations.literal: Now again increase with Chu weight, Chu Li Zi certainly speak Qin, again give Chu invaded lands.'
translations.idiomatic: Now again increasing it with Chu's weight, Chu Li Zi will certainly speak for Qin and again give back Chu's invaded lands.'

sentences.zh: 於是懷王許之，竟不合秦，而合齊以善韓。

translations.literal: Thereupon Huai Wang permitted it. He finally did not ally with Qin, but allied with Qi to befriend Han.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King Huai agreed. In the end, he did not ally with Qin, but allied with Qi to befriend Han.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，倍齊而合秦。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, he betrayed Qi and allied with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, he betrayed Qi and allied with Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王初立，乃厚賂於楚。

translations.literal: Qin Zhao Wang was first established and then heavily bribed Chu.
translations.idiomatic: When King Zhao of Qin first ascended the throne, he heavily bribed Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚往迎婦。

translations.literal: Chu went to welcome the bride.
translations.idiomatic: Chu went to welcome the bride.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，懷王入與秦昭王盟，約於黃棘。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Huai Wang entered and allied with Qin Zhao Wang, with the agreement at Huang Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, King Huai entered Qin territory and formed an alliance with King Zhao of Qin at Huangji.

sentences.zh: 秦復與楚上庸。

translations.literal: Qin again gave Shang Yong to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Qin again ceded Shangyong to Chu.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，齊、韓、魏為楚負其從親而合於秦，三國共伐楚。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi, Han, and Wei, because Chu betrayed the alliance's closeness and allied with Qin, the three states together attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi, Han, and Wei, angered that Chu had betrayed their alliance and allied with Qin, attacked Chu together.

sentences.zh: 楚使太子入質於秦而請救。

translations.literal: Chu sent the crown prince to enter as hostage in Qin and requested aid.
translations.idiomatic: Chu sent the crown prince as hostage to Qin and requested aid.

sentences.zh: 秦乃遣客卿通將兵救楚，三國引兵去。

translations.literal: Qin then sent guest minister Tong to lead troops and save Chu. The three states withdrew their troops and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Qin then sent the guest minister Tong to lead troops to rescue Chu. The three states withdrew their armies.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，秦大夫有私與楚太子鬬，楚太子殺之而亡歸。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, a Qin grandee privately fought with the Chu crown prince. The Chu crown prince killed him and fled back.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, a Qin minister quarreled privately with the Chu crown prince. The crown prince killed him and fled back to Chu.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，秦乃與齊、韓、魏共攻楚，殺楚將唐眛，取我重丘而去。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Qin then together with Qi, Han, and Wei attacked Chu. They killed Chu general Tang Mei, took our Chong Qiu, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Qin joined with Qi, Han, and Wei to attack Chu. They killed the Chu general Tangmei, captured our Chongqiu, and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，秦復攻楚，大破楚，楚軍死者二萬，殺我將軍景缺。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin again attacked Chu and greatly broke Chu. Twenty thousand of the Chu army died. They killed our general Jing Que.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin attacked Chu again and decisively defeated them. Twenty thousand Chu soldiers died. They killed our general Jingque.

sentences.zh: 懷王恐，乃使太子為質於齊以求平。

translations.literal: Huai Wang feared and then sent the crown prince as hostage to Qi to seek peace.
